description: The Windows signature verification process previously suffered from improper validation because it failed to check if the file path reported by the underlying signing tool (`LiteralPath`) matched the path of the update file being processed. The original implementation actively discarded this path information, creating a security bypass opportunity. This oversight could allow an attacker to substitute an unsigned, malicious file for a legitimately signed placeholder during the update process. The fix ensures that the normalized file path returned by the signature verification process strictly matches the expected update file path before proceeding.
name: github.com_electron-userland_electron-builder_ac2e6a25aa491c1ef5167a552c19fc2085cd427f.patch

description: The Electron framework's WebContents.sendToFrame API previously located the target frame using only the integer frameId without validating the associated renderer process ID. If an attacker knew the frame ID of a privileged frame (potentially in a different process), they could send arbitrary IPC messages, violating security boundaries and leading to improper authorization. The fix enforces that messages sent via sendToFrame must be targeted using both the frame ID and the correct process ID, preventing cross-process messaging exploits.
name: github.com_electron_electron_07a1c2a3e5845901f7e2eda9506695be58edc73c.patch

description: The application used an incorrect check (`=== 0`) to determine if a custom handler for the sensitive 'select-bluetooth-device' event was registered. Since the internal default cancellation handler is also counted as a listener, the condition was never correctly triggered when the application failed to register a handler. This logic error prevented the automatic cancellation of unauthorized Bluetooth device selection requests, potentially allowing device enumeration to proceed without explicit application handling.
name: github.com_electron_electron_105ab32645822dd76895de7b969df167fbfe77fa.patch

description: The patch addresses a security bypass issue in Electron related to navigation handling. Previously, the `will-navigate` security hook was incomplete, missing certain renderer-initiated navigations, such as when a cross-origin iframe navigated the top frame. This omission allowed attackers to bypass security logic implemented by developers relying on `will-navigate` to restrict unauthorized URL loading. The fix moves the navigation emission logic into a specialized `NavigationThrottle` to ensure all relevant main frame navigations are intercepted and checked.
name: github.com_electron_electron_18613925610ba319da7f497b6deed85ad712c59b.patch

description: The application incorrectly determined if a custom handler was registered for the 'select-bluetooth-device' event by checking if the listener count was zero. Since the internal initialization logic registers one listener, this check always failed when no custom handler was present. This failure resulted in the inability to automatically cancel the Bluetooth device selection request, potentially leading to unintended behavior or unauthorized device interaction.
name: github.com_electron_electron_6dc9d0629acb40243ef4121aa09349abbe6dd43a.patch

description: The Electron framework failed to correctly integrate Node.js's V8 code generation policy with Chromium/Blink's policy when both environments were loaded. This misconfiguration meant that the permissive Node policy could override Blink's Content Security Policy (CSP) restrictions. Consequently, an attacker could bypass CSP directives aimed at blocking 'unsafe-eval', allowing unauthorized execution of dynamic JavaScript code generated from strings.
name: github.com_electron_electron_9e7fbc7021d8d716c43782249a552e55289c35db.patch

description: Before this patch, Electron's `select-bluetooth-device` event would potentially proceed if web content requested device access and no explicit handler was registered. This lack of default denial led to improper authorization and exposure of Bluetooth device lists to unauthorized renderer processes. The fix introduces a default handler that explicitly cancels the device selection request if `listenerCount` is zero, enforcing secure access control by default.
name: github.com_electron_electron_a6f04822d9ff0eea4c8227f5f59d3c5e37e684d6.patch

description: The vulnerability stemmed from exposing the privileged `nativeImage.createThumbnailFromPath` function via an IPC endpoint to the renderer process. This allowed potentially untrusted renderer code to invoke file system operations (thumbnail generation) using arbitrary paths provided as input. Removing this IPC wrapper enforces the security boundary between the renderer and the main process, preventing unauthorized file access or resource consumption attacks.
name: github.com_electron_electron_aa9da78edb6200988b104914e09995115ee132ee.patch

description: The application initializes an internal listener for 'select-bluetooth-device' which is intended to enforce default cancellation if no external handler is registered by the developer. The underlying logic was flawed because it checked if the listener count was zero, but since the internal listener itself exists, the correct check should have been against one. This error prevented the default security mechanism (cancelling the Bluetooth device selection prompt) from executing when no custom handler was present, potentially leading to undesired device connections.
name: github.com_electron_electron_ab94340567cc50002d578f9c8e2bd883cd2984e5.patch

description: The Electron Context Bridge implementation failed to correctly enforce V8 context isolation boundaries during proxy object creation. Key setup steps, including fetching property names using `GetOwnPropertyNames`, were executed before entering the required isolated destination context scope. This allowed synchronous script execution triggered by property lookups (e.g., malicious getters) to run in an unexpected context, resulting in a context isolation bypass vulnerability.
name: github.com_electron_electron_b8e347709245d2dc5640fbb3044d9b21b4eaa6b0.patch

description: The application registered a default listener for the 'select-bluetooth-device' event, intended to cancel the event if no external listeners were provided by the user application. The original logic contained an off-by-one error, checking if the listener count was 0, failing to recognize that the default handler itself increased the count to 1. This failure prevented the event from being correctly cancelled, potentially allowing unauthorized system interaction (like displaying the Bluetooth device selection dialog) when no handler was configured.
name: github.com_electron_electron_d5dd50f87e3de5c026f60f155bb9c312bc766aee.patch

description: The application contained faulty logic when handling the 'select-bluetooth-device' event, designed to automatically cancel the request if no user-defined handler was registered. The internal default handler incorrectly checked if the listener count was zero. Since the default handler itself is counted as one listener, this check caused the cancellation logic to be skipped, allowing unintended Bluetooth access or unexpected application flow.
name: github.com_electron_electron_ea8275042bc54d4a313657738e763a22659f55e3.patch

description: The Electron framework's internal handler for the 'select-bluetooth-device' event contained faulty logic to check if any user-defined handlers were present. The original code incorrectly checked if the listener count was 0, but because the internal default handler was itself registered, the count was always at least 1. This prevented the intended security mechanism (cancelling the event if unhandled) from activating, leading to unauthorized Bluetooth device enumeration or selection if the application did not explicitly implement a handler.
name: github.com_electron_electron_ffbaa1d83f6612ae7f7aac03feeca62973cd36ba.patch

description: The application, responsible for embedding integrity information into executable resources, incorrectly dereferenced a Node.js Buffer object by accessing its ".buffer" property. This action exposed the raw underlying ArrayBuffer, potentially leading to improper serialization or memory boundary issues when writing the resource data. This flawed buffer handling could cause the resulting executable to be malformed, resulting in application failure or crashes.
name: github.com_electron_packager_d421d4bd3ced889a4143c5c3ab6d95e3be249eee.patch

description: The application component responsible for generating table poppers assigned dynamically sourced content directly to the DOM element's innerHTML property. This assignment was performed without adequately escaping or sanitizing HTML special characters within the `popperContent` variable. This oversight created a Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability where malicious input could execute arbitrary JavaScript in the user's browser. The fix resolves this by applying the `escape-html` utility function to the content before insertion into innerHTML.
name: github.com_element-plus_element-plus_063c56446135176971f532bd0eb2e88a0b137d43.patch

description: The vulnerability was a Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) issue caused by performing HTML sanitization on the wrong input stage. The original code applied DOMPurify.sanitize to the raw markdown input *before* converting it to HTML using 'markdown_to_html'. This allowed malicious HTML structures introduced or generated during the markdown processing step to bypass the sanitizer entirely. The fix ensures that sanitization is applied to the final HTML output, preventing XSS.
name: github.com_enchant97_note-mark_a0997facb82f85bfb8c0d497606d89e7d150e182.patch

description: The Eta template engine improperly merged configuration options derived from the user-supplied `data` object during `renderFile` execution, specifically handling properties found in `data.settings` passed by Express. This design allowed attackers, if they controlled the data object, to inject arbitrary configuration options (like file paths via `views` or arbitrary settings via `view options`). By preventing the configuration object from being derived or overwritten by data properties, the patch successfully mitigates this risk of configuration injection and potential path manipulation.
name: github.com_eta-dev_eta_5651392462ee0ff19d77c8481081a99e5b9138dd.patch

description: The vulnerability allowed sensitive configuration data, specifically the SERVER_SIDE_FIDES_API_URL, to be exposed to client-side scripts and browser responses. This URL was intended only for internal, server-side API communication but was mistakenly included in client configuration interfaces like FidesInitOptions. The patch strictly separates server-side only settings, preventing unauthorized exposure of potentially internal API endpoints.
name: github.com_ethyca_fides_0555080541f18a5aacff452c590ac9a1b56d7097.patch

description: The application allowed users to upload custom connector templates which could include arbitrary Python code designated as custom functions. This code was executed server-side using RestrictedPython in an attempt to sandbox potentially malicious operations. The patch removes this feature entirely, mitigating the risk that the sandboxing mechanism could be bypassed, leading to a Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability.
name: github.com_ethyca_fides_5989b5fa744c8d8c340963b895a054883549358a.patch

description: The application dynamically injected a client-side polyfill script from the external service polyfill.io if the browser lacked the native fetch implementation. Relying on external, non-audited third-party script services via dynamic script injection introduces a severe supply chain risk. If the external polyfill service were compromised, this mechanism could lead to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) by executing arbitrary malicious code in the end-user's browser.
name: github.com_ethyca_fides_868c4d629760572192bd61db34f5a4458ed12005.patch

description: The system handles embedding external links, relying on iframe sandboxing to isolate third-party content. The previous implementation of `getEmbedLink` failed to explicitly define the critical `allowSameOrigin` sandbox flag for numerous embed types derived from approved domains. If the runtime iframe rendering component defaulted to an insecure configuration when this flag was absent, it could potentially allow compromised embedded content inappropriate access to the parent document context. The patch explicitly calculates and enforces the necessary restrictive sandboxing based on a whitelist.
name: github.com_excalidraw_excalidraw_6be752e1b6d776ccfbd3bb9eea17463cb264121d.patch

description: The application failed to consistently generate the necessary security configurations (sandbox attributes) for embedded third-party content, especially for domains hosting user-supplied code like StackBlitz. The logic determining the `allowSameOrigin` sandbox flag was missing or inconsistently applied across various link types. This vulnerability led to undefined or non-optimal security restrictions on iframes, potentially enabling sandbox escape or improper cross-origin access if the default browser behavior was permissive. The patch enforces explicit calculation and inclusion of the `sandbox` configuration for all supported embedded links.
name: github.com_excalidraw_excalidraw_988f81911ca58e3ca2583e0dd44a954dd00e09d0.patch

description: The application failed to sufficiently sanitize user-provided hyperlink URLs before rendering them to the DOM or opening them, relying on a custom, weak `normalizeLink` function. This allowed attackers to inject malicious code via script protocols (e.g., `javascript:`), resulting in a stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability. The fix introduces strong URL sanitization using the `@braintree/sanitize-url` library, ensuring only safe protocols are accepted.
name: github.com_excalidraw_excalidraw_b33fa6d6f64d27adc3a47b25c0aa55711740d0af.patch

description: The Lexical link node component failed to validate the protocol scheme of user-provided URLs when creating the anchor element's `href` attribute in the DOM. This allowed attackers to inject `javascript:` protocol URLs, which, upon rendering and clicking, could lead to client-side script execution (Cross-Site Scripting). The fix introduces a `sanitizeUrl` method that strictly whitelists safe protocols (http, https, mailto, etc.) and defaults malicious or unrecognized protocols to 'about:blank'.
name: github.com_facebook_lexical_601741046f3bf124c6e9504c24e8d8cba93ce730.patch

description: The patch refactors the core functionality for handling user clicks on links by moving it into a dedicated, reusable plugin. Crucially, the refactor removes a CSS rule that previously disabled native browser click handling on links via `pointer-events: none`. Although primarily a feature addition, the new plugin implements robust JavaScript event interception and uses `event.preventDefault()` to enforce custom navigation logic, mitigating potential Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) risks that could arise if native link navigation executed malicious `javascript:` protocols.
name: github.com_facebook_lexical_f77d7c7459d51ba55a5c51b97d6e6424c8bc6401.patch

description: The application suffered from a Session Fixation vulnerability because the session ID was not regenerated upon successful user authentication (login). If an attacker provided a valid, unauthenticated session ID to a victim, they could hijack the authenticated session after the victim logged in. The patch fixes this by ensuring `request.session.regenerate()` is called immediately before storing the user object in the session during login, invalidating the old session ID and preventing fixation attacks.
name: github.com_fastify_fastify-passport_43c82c321db58ea3e375dd475de60befbfcf2a11.patch

description: The vulnerability was a Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) flaw located in the CSS attribute selector parsing mechanism. The parser utilized a complex regular expression (`reAttr`) which was susceptible to catastrophic backtracking when processing specially crafted malicious input strings. The patch replaces the problematic regex with hand-rolled, linear attribute parsing logic to ensure consistent performance and mitigate the DoS risk.
name: github.com_fb55_css-what_4cdaacfd0d4b6fd00614be030da0dea6c2994655.patch

description: The vulnerability was a Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) residing in the CSS `:nth-child` formula parsing logic. The library utilized a complex regex pattern containing overlapping optional groups and quantified elements (e.g., `\d*`, `\s*`). Malicious or highly non-matching input could trigger catastrophic backtracking within the regex engine. The patch fixed this issue by replacing the potentially vulnerable regular expression with a safe, hand-rolled linear parser.
name: github.com_fb55_nth-check_9894c1d2010870c351f66c6f6efcf656e26bb726.patch

description: FeathersJS sockets did not properly validate the type of the 'path' parameter supplied by the client during service method calls. An attacker could send non-string values (e.g., null or objects) instead of a service path string, potentially leading to unexpected runtime errors or incorrect service lookups. The fix explicitly checks if the path parameter is a string, defaulting non-string paths to null and returning a controlled 'Invalid service path' error if validation fails.
name: github.com_feathersjs_feathers_0b9a6b19b12ad05934e4c8bd9917448ed39d1ed8.patch

description: The deepExtend utility function did not validate property names when recursively copying data from a source object to a target object. This oversight allowed attackers to inject the reserved '__proto__' property into the source, leading to JavaScript Prototype Pollution. The fix introduces an explicit check to ensure that the '__proto__' key is skipped during the merging process.
name: github.com_firebase_firebase-js-sdk_9cf727fcc3d049551b16ae0698ac33dc2fe45ada.patch

description: The application's sensitive data export endpoint accepted POST requests without verifying the request origin or implementing CSRF protection. This oversight allowed an attacker to execute a Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) attack, forcing a victim's browser to trigger a data export operation. The fix blocks any request containing an 'Origin' header, effectively preventing web browser-initiated cross-site requests to this endpoint. This ensures that the data export functionality is protected from unauthorized external callers.
name: github.com_firebase_firebase-tools_068a2b08dc308c7ab4b569617f5fc8821237e3a0.patch

description: The application's translation utility failed to properly escape string parameters provided for interpolation, allowing HTML injection. When a user input (such as a username) containing script tags was passed to the Translator parameters, it was returned unescaped. The vulnerability led to stored or reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) upon rendering. The patch corrects this by ensuring all string parameters are wrapped in JSX elements, thereby triggering automatic HTML entity encoding by the React rendering engine.
name: github.com_flarum_core_440bed81b8019dff00642c8f493b4909d505a28a.patch

description: The application suffered from a reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability because the page title was rendered using unescaped output (`{!! $title !!}`) in the Blade template. This allowed user-controlled input within the title variable to execute arbitrary HTML or scripts in the client's browser context. The patch corrects this by using proper escaping (`{{ $title }}`) in the template and implementing secure DOM parsing in the frontend JavaScript logic to decode entities without introducing XSS risk into `document.title`.
name: github.com_flarum_core_690de9ce0ffe7ac4d45b73e303f44340c3433138.patch

description: The application's translation utility did not properly escape string parameters used for interpolation before they were rendered to the client. This lack of sanitization allowed attackers to inject malicious HTML or script content via string parameters when they were displayed in translated phrases, leading to a Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability. The patch fixes this by iterating over all parameters and explicitly wrapping string values in JSX fragments, which ensures automatic context-aware escaping when the output is rendered.
name: github.com_flarum_framework_440bed81b8019dff00642c8f493b4909d505a28a.patch

description: The vulnerability existed because the server-side template used unescaped output (`{!! $title !!}`) to render the page title, allowing injection of arbitrary HTML/script content if the title variable was derived from user input. This resulted in a Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability during the initial page load. The fix involves switching to safe, escaped output (`{{ $title }}`) in the Blade template and utilizing DOMParser for safer entity decoding when updating the title client-side.
name: github.com_flarum_framework_690de9ce0ffe7ac4d45b73e303f44340c3433138.patch

description: The library dynamically generates JavaScript functions to optimize JSON pointer dereferencing performance. When constructing the code, path segments used as property keys were enclosed in single quotes but only backslashes were escaped. This insufficient sanitization allowed an attacker to terminate the string literal using a single quote, leading to injection of arbitrary code into the dynamically generated function.
name: github.com_flitbit_json-ptr_2539e3494c80af1eef24f0f433654a61f255f011.patch

description: The application's utility functions, specifically 'setValueAtPath' and 'unsetValueAtPath', failed to adequately validate input path segments used for object manipulation. This failure allowed path segments to include JavaScript prototype inheritance keywords such as '__proto__', 'constructor', or 'prototype'. An attacker could exploit this issue to perform Prototype Pollution, potentially leading to remote code execution or denial of service depending on the subsequent usage of polluted objects. The patch prevents this by explicitly checking for these forbidden keywords and raising an error.
name: github.com_flitbit_json-ptr_5dc458fbad1c382a2e3ca6d62e66ede3d92849ca.patch

description: The library previously allowed configuration options, including the sensitive 'url' parameter used for self-hosted translation engines, to be supplied directly as runtime arguments to the main translation function. If these options were controlled by untrusted user input, an attacker could specify an arbitrary endpoint URL, forcing the server to perform requests to internal or malicious external hosts, resulting in a Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability. The fix restricts the runtime arguments to only language parameters ('from' and 'to') and rejects configuration options like 'engine' or 'url', mitigating the risk.
name: github.com_franciscop_translate_cc1ba03078102f83e0503a96f1a081489bb865d3.patch

description: The application used `Object.assign` to populate Data Transfer Objects (DTOs) from request bodies before validation using `class-validator`. This method failed to correctly instantiate nested objects within the DTO structure, causing validation rules defined using `@ValidateNested` or `@Type` to be silently bypassed. The fix introduces `class-transformer` and uses `plainToInstance` to ensure the incoming request data is correctly deserialized into class instances, thereby enforcing validation on nested fields.
name: github.com_frouriojs_frourio-express_73ded5c6f9f1c126c0cb2d05c0505e9e4db142d2.patch

description: The application, which uses class-validator for input sanitization, failed to correctly validate deeply nested request body objects. This was because input objects were instantiated using a shallow copy method (Object.assign) instead of a class transformer, preventing class-validator from recognizing and executing nested validation rules defined via decorators like @Type and @ValidateNested. This allowed attackers to bypass strict schema constraints by supplying malformed data in nested fields, potentially leading to downstream type confusion or processing errors. The fix incorporates the 'class-transformer' library and uses 'plainToInstance' to correctly convert incoming data into validated class instances.
name: github.com_frouriojs_frourio_7c19ac5363305b81b1c6b5232620228763d427af.patch

description: The application is vulnerable to command injection because it does not properly validate the host argument passed to the ping function. An attacker could inject arbitrary commands by providing a malicious host string. The fix implements a validation function `isValidHost` to prevent this.
name: github.com_genieacs_genieacs_7f295beeecc1c1f14308a93c82413bb334045af6.patch

description: This patch updates the font used in the application. It replaces 'Droid Serif' with 'Noto Serif' for improved aesthetics or licensing reasons. The changes are mostly in CSS and component files to ensure consistent font usage.
name: github.com_getgridea_gridea_0374add4ff98afcab2c2a8b0c5d1473408917bd9.patch

description: The code uses `DOMParser` instead of `innerHTML` to parse HTML. Using `innerHTML` can lead to XSS vulnerabilities if the HTML content is from an untrusted source, as it executes scripts embedded in the HTML. `DOMParser` helps prevent XSS by parsing the HTML into a DOM tree without automatically executing scripts.
name: github.com_github_paste-markdown_32b7ea3f29ae8f256f9d19768387be42678ddf30.patch

description: The change modifies the configuration settings for the CodeQL distribution in the VS Code extension. The scope of the `codeQL.cli.executablePath` setting is changed from `window` to `machine`. It also removes the `ownerName` and `repositoryName` settings.
name: github.com_github_vscode-codeql_36fedac2ca2f2912a4de3ca2536e06c131513e63.patch

description: This patch changes the scope of the 'codeQL.cli.executablePath' setting from 'window' to 'machine'. It removes owner and repository name settings related to distribution configuration. This change configures the CodeQL distribution settings to machine scope.
name: github.com_github_vscode-codeql_8400f75bb55e72b3c8675ffe4c03e5090b75e554.patch

description: The application was vulnerable to open redirect because it did not properly validate the protocol of the URL before redirecting. The fix introduces a whitelist of trusted protocols to allow redirection only to those protocols. This prevents attackers from redirecting users to malicious websites.
name: github.com_gitpod-io_gitpod_6771283c3406586e352337675b79ff2ca50f191b.patch

description: The application is vulnerable to open redirect via the `returnTo` parameter. The patch ensures that the `returnTo` parameter is sanitized to prevent redirection to arbitrary URLs. This prevents attackers from phishing or redirecting users to malicious sites after authentication.
name: github.com_gitpod-io_gitpod_8ca431f86ae3a6f9a17afcfed51cdd065fcff1a5.patch

description: The patch enhances cookie security by using the `__Host-` prefix and removing the domain attribute. The changes prevent subdomains from accessing the authentication cookie, mitigating potential cross-site scripting (XSS) or session fixation attacks. The patch also handles scenarios where requests originate from subdomains, ensuring proper cookie setting on the base domain.
name: github.com_gitpod-io_gitpod_da1053e1013f27a56e6d3533aa251dbd241d0155.patch

description: This patch updates the authentik version from 2023.8.5 to 2023.8.6. The changes are across multiple files, including configuration, go files and typescript. This appears to be a routine release update rather than a specific vulnerability fix.
name: github.com_goauthentik_authentik_2a3d2cd262cf7588506cbcab32f8f5cf0351aba8.patch

description: The patch fixes a path traversal vulnerability when serving static files for web components. It restricts the allowed file extensions to only serve .js and .css files, preventing arbitrary file access. The `safe_join` function is used to prevent path traversal.
name: github.com_google_mesop_17fb769d6a91f0a8cbccfab18f64977b158a6a31.patch

description: The patch addresses XSS vulnerabilities in dashboard links and panel markdown. It utilizes the `$sanitize` service to sanitize the HTML content of dashboard links and panel markdown, preventing the execution of malicious scripts. The vulnerability exists because the application was not properly sanitizing user-provided or dynamically generated content before rendering it in the UI.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_00454b32f5db19f9dee4fa05b5cff5e24941548d.patch

description: The Grafana table panel had an XSS vulnerability due to not properly escaping the column title and link tooltip. This patch escapes the column title and link tooltip using `textUtil.escapeHtml` to prevent XSS. The vulnerability is in the table panel, which is part of the Grafana application.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_0284747c88eb9435899006d26ffaf65f89dec88e.patch

description: The patch addresses an improper authorization vulnerability in Grafana snapshots. Previously, anonymous users could create snapshots even when snapshot public mode was disabled. The fix ensures that only signed-in users can create snapshots when public mode is disabled.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_064546f3823ea40f59c22832f1966524f798f8be.patch

description: The patch introduces a configuration option to disable HTML sanitization. Disabling sanitization can lead to cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities if user-provided or external HTML content is displayed without proper escaping. The application now checks the `disableSanitizeInput` config before sanitizing the HTML content.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_08dc5a4f9783a0ca0d9c6b703a883cbab1369c04.patch

description: The patch fixes an issue related to annotations display in the TablePanel. The original code did not properly handle the annotations data, leading to incorrect display. The updated code processes the annotations data and updates the component's state to ensure proper rendering.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_095c4cab6a6ee996ab321d579b1ad1e39ac202b4.patch

description: The patch fixes broken variable queries in CloudMonitoring that use group bys. The issue was caused by incorrect parameters being passed to the getLabels function. The fix updates the function calls to include the required aggregation parameters.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_0a8f4cff3e46e4107b39763b12ac5030a0204c81.patch

description: This patch enhances the CloudWatch datasource in Grafana to allow users to search for log groups that might not be initially present. It improves the user experience when working with CloudWatch logs by merging remote search results with existing results. The change ensures that the available log groups are updated dynamically as the user searches.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_0e8638ec925b0d73e15a0ffc783b5a2becd5264e.patch

description: The patch removes the `cryo` library and replaces its usage with `JSON.stringify` and `JSON.parse` for object serialization. This change likely addresses potential security vulnerabilities or compatibility issues associated with the `cryo` library. Additionally, the patch updates the cache key generation for run and test results to include a version number, likely to prevent issues with backwards compatibility after format changes.
name: github.com_garden-io_garden_3117964da40d3114f129a6131b4ada89eaa4eb8c.patch

description: The patch addresses an improper authorization vulnerability by requiring an authentication key for accessing server endpoints. It introduces authentication checks in the HTTP API and websocket connections to ensure only authorized requests are processed. This prevents unauthorized access to sensitive functionalities.
name: github.com_garden-io_garden_56051a5b50409227bc420910da88ed156a6e432b.patch

description: The application was vulnerable to improper validation of the 'orgid' and 'projectid' parameters in the tunnel target, which could lead to unexpected behavior or potential exploitation. The fix involves strictly validating these parameters using regular expressions to only allow hexadecimal characters for 'orgid' and digits for 'projectid'. This change prevents arbitrary values from being used in the tunnel rewrite rules.
name: github.com_getsentry_sentry-javascript_ddbda3c02c35aba8c5235e0cf07fc5bf656f81be.patch

description: The patch addresses an issue where regular expressions were being created during route interpolation in the Astro framework. This could lead to performance problems and potential security issues if user-supplied parameters contain regex metacharacters. The fix replaces the regex-based approach with string manipulation for route parameter replacement.
name: github.com_getsentry_sentry-javascript_fe24eb5eefa9d27b14b2b6f9ebd1debca1c208fb.patch

description: The patch disables Git access in Restricted Mode (untrusted workspaces) within the application. It introduces a new error `WorkspaceUntrustedError` and checks `workspace.isTrusted` before performing Git operations. This prevents potentially unsafe Git commands from being executed in untrusted environments.
name: github.com_gitkraken_vscode-gitlens_ee2a0c42a92d33059a39fd15fbbd5dd3d5ab6440.patch

description: The patch improves CSRF protection for websocket connections. It enforces stricter origin checks, especially for cookie/session-based authentication. The server now verifies the Origin header against the expected Gitpod hostname, preventing unauthorized connections from different origins.
name: github.com_gitpod-io_gitpod_12956988eec0031f42ffdfa3bdc3359f65628f9f.patch

description: This patch represents a version bump from 2023.10.5 to 2023.10.6. It updates the version number across multiple files including configuration, go files, and typescript files. This change does not directly address a specific vulnerability but rather reflects a release update.
name: github.com_goauthentik_authentik_1cd000dfe204b9605c85e6cebc051586a0329604.patch

description: This patch adds support for Notation UI related to deployment security. It introduces a new checkbox for enabling content trust using Notary. The patch also updates translations and components to reflect the change from 'Notary' to 'Notation'.
name: github.com_goharbor_harbor_79e8c396bfa67134af0de767dae091dd3969fcb3.patch

description: This patch adds functionality to automatically generate a Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) when images are pushed to the project registry. It introduces a new toggle in the project configuration page to enable or disable this feature. The change involves adding a new checkbox and related text to the UI and updating the project service to handle the new configuration option.
name: github.com_goharbor_harbor_9b7c1a2274fbc5ea16e19a484532f86c08926577.patch

description: The patch adds a new URI path to the `ShouldNotReuseRoute` array. This array likely defines routes that should not be reused for caching or other purposes. The addition of this new URI path aims to fix issue #19216.
name: github.com_goharbor_harbor_d69572d51ab8fa92cac2b4ca2b8e5739de48e0b4.patch

description: The patch addresses a vulnerability where the rendering service was susceptible to rendering local file paths, posing a security risk. It introduces an authentication token mechanism to prevent unauthorized access to render and sanitize endpoints for both HTTP and gRPC requests. Additionally, it validates URLs to ensure they use either HTTP or HTTPS protocols, preventing potentially dangerous URL schemes.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana-image-renderer_7029bba294209d17d512400b0ed7f71bdf9fb9d7.patch

description: The OpenTSDB datasource was vulnerable to XSS. The tag value was not properly sanitized, allowing for the injection of malicious HTML. This patch adds HTML sanitization to the tag value to prevent XSS attacks.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_125ba95686df79989626ac1e8aa48e582c0efd98.patch

description: The patch introduces input sanitization to prevent XSS vulnerabilities. The text panel in Grafana was vulnerable to XSS. The fix uses the 'xss' library to sanitize user input in the text panel before rendering it.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_15d560a1c01f5bfb354f83183886881554026bb8.patch

description: The patch addresses an issue in the CloudWatch datasource plugin where log groups were not correctly invalidated when switching datasources. This could lead to unexpected behavior or incorrect data being displayed. The fix ensures that the selected log groups are properly updated when the region changes.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_1b29d3460e9fcc44fec738a716bfdbca2c8f9630.patch

description: The patch adds DOMPurify to sanitize SVG files. This prevents potential XSS vulnerabilities.  The application was vulnerable to XSS via uploaded SVG files.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_1c8a50b36973bd59a1cc5f34c30de8a9a6a431f0.patch

description: The patch addresses a potential XSS vulnerability by reversing the logic of the `sanitize_input` configuration option. It changes the setting to `disable_sanitize_input`, defaulting to `false`. This ensures that input sanitization is enabled by default, mitigating the risk of XSS attacks.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_1ed35f3dc117db7feed6d8c2a950e22713c17d1b.patch

description: The patch addresses a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability related to the `originalUrl` of dashboard snapshots.  The vulnerability allowed for spoofing the `originalUrl`, potentially redirecting users to malicious sites. The fix validates the dashboard UID and sanitizes the URL to prevent the security issue.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_239888f22983010576bb3a9135a7294e88c0c74a.patch

description: This patch focuses on preventing hidden dataframe fields from being displayed in tables, specifically within the CloudWatch datasource. The changes modify how fields are filtered and displayed in components like tables and log details. Internal log identifiers are also properly handled to ensure correct query execution.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_277aee864269753d45a2a2e725998aac59f592e9.patch

description: The reverted commit attempted to prevent Angular initialization when the path contained interpolation directives ({{ or %7B%7B). This was likely intended to mitigate a potential XSS vulnerability where user-controlled URLs could be manipulated. Reverting this change reintroduces the risk of XSS through URL manipulation.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_31b78d51c693d828720a5b285107a50e6024c912.patch

description: The patch addresses an issue in the TablePanel where annotations were not being properly displayed. It modifies the module.ts file to correctly handle the annotation data. The code now updates the component's state with the annotation data, enabling correct rendering.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_35e1524b0205a9a97f1a981e05d06646238be750.patch

description: The patch fixes an XSS vulnerability in the annotation popup. The vulnerability occurs because the text field of the annotation is not properly sanitized before being displayed in the tooltip. By adding `ng-non-bindable`, the text is displayed as is without AngularJS interpreting its contents.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_3955e8cbad3dac9f891cfcd462341e766d6cc5ba.patch

description: This patch adds more examples to the CloudWatch Logs cheatsheet. It enhances the existing documentation with more query examples for various AWS services. The changes aim to improve user understanding and usage of CloudWatch Logs.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_395cc26019861a75817f5f4c396303d39abbbf5a.patch

description: The application sanitizes Angular interpolation in URLs. The patch replaces a string replacement method `replaceAll` with regular expression replacements to ensure all instances of the interpolation characters are properly encoded. This prevents potential XSS attacks by encoding potentially malicious code injected via Angular interpolation.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_3cb5214fa45eb5a571fd70d6c6edf0d729983f82.patch

description: The Graphite plugin was vulnerable to XSS via the function tooltip. The application used `dangerouslySetInnerHTML` with `rst2html` to render the description, which could execute arbitrary JavaScript. The fix removes the use of `dangerouslySetInnerHTML` and directly renders the description as text.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_42911348a76e8484396b951bef8b7bff97a84cbc.patch

description: The patch addresses a security vulnerability related to storing datasource passwords in Grafana. Previously, passwords were stored in plain text, making them vulnerable to unauthorized access. The fix involves encrypting these passwords and storing them in `secureJsonData`.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_66f6e16916fa1813e30c2ddd271acaf511cee560.patch

description: The patch fixes an issue where data source variables were not being added to the adhoc configuration. The getDatasourceSrv().getList() function was called with the variables option set to false, which prevented data source variables from being included. This has been fixed by setting the variables option to true.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_6fe27c5274045e22496a7272dceb2d3a70bc1065.patch

description: This patch improves error handling for Azure Monitor variable queries in Grafana. It enhances error messages, providing more informative feedback to users. The changes primarily focus on improving the user experience when dealing with invalid subscription IDs and other query-related issues.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_75b2a92c633d80cadb280fa2c5521e6371110800.patch

description: This patch focuses on UI updates to the alerting tab in Grafana. The changes include using a confirm button, removing an uncommented import, and updating button styles. No specific vulnerability is addressed in this patch.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_7d58ec3d4779f4821ecda98fa168b33db165a13f.patch

description: The patch addresses a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability where HTML in drilldown links was not fully escaped, allowing for potential injection of malicious scripts. The fix introduces the `escapeHtml` function to properly escape HTML entities in link attributes such as `href` and `target`. This ensures that user-supplied content is treated as plain text, preventing XSS attacks.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_8a68c29e54c6155acc60d926ff2cb52ecf4471f1.patch

description: The patch introduces DOMPurify to sanitize SVG files, mitigating potential cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities. By sanitizing the SVG code, the application prevents the execution of malicious scripts embedded within the SVG files. This change ensures that only safe and trusted SVG content is rendered, reducing the risk of XSS attacks.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_8b574e22b53aa4c5a35032a58844fd4aaaa12f5f.patch

description: The patch changes the date/time values in a CloudWatch datasource test to use UTC. This ensures consistency and avoids potential issues related to time zone differences during testing. The change involves adding 'Z' to the date/time strings to explicitly indicate UTC.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_98d56336016066fad0758b1f18841eeb2fd920e4.patch

description: The patch addresses two XSS vulnerabilities. One is in the table panel header column rename, and the other is in the annotation popup.  These vulnerabilities could allow attackers to inject arbitrary HTML or JavaScript code into the affected areas.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_a04ef6cefc2f24f901f525263f65cf395e6cff28.patch

description: The text panel wasn't re-rendering upon mode change. The panel content watch was updated to also include panel mode. Now the text panel re-renders correctly.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_a3e13b333e8b790a3466263f9a8c0c4fa5fc4d07.patch

description: This patch removes support for an old query syntax related to regular expressions in Loki. This change simplifies the query parsing logic and removes related tests. The removal doesn't directly address a specific vulnerability but improves the codebase by removing deprecated features.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_bf8f3c03b8a74069e79589649fea5dc08fe4c311.patch

description: The patch addresses an issue in the CloudWatch datasource where variables in CloudWatch Logs queries were not correctly interpolated. This could lead to unexpected query behavior or potentially expose sensitive information if variables are not properly sanitized. The fix ensures that the 'queryString' property of queries is processed using the `replace` function to correctly interpolate variables.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_bfd337dd004ef837eec112ee94ba64d5e213b8b8.patch

description: The patch introduces `DOMPurify` to sanitize SVG content, addressing a potential XSS vulnerability. The vulnerability exists due to the use of user-provided or external SVG files without proper sanitization. The `SanitizedSVG` component now preprocesses SVG code to remove potentially malicious content.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_c022534e3848a5d45c0b3face23b43aa44e4400a.patch

description: The patch addresses a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability within the Grafana graph panel, specifically affecting series overrides. User-supplied aliases were not properly sanitized, allowing for the injection of malicious scripts that would be executed in the context of the user's browser. The fix involves input validation and output encoding to prevent script injection.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_c53435f7a76f79a07bac2fe1a66827624e217a1c.patch

description: This patch migrates local storage of query history to remote storage. It includes changes to the storage mechanism, data filtering, and user interface elements. The patch also addresses accessibility issues by modifying HTML elements and ARIA attributes.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_c6c79a936050fa2e3acec24852a1546b6e599cf8.patch

description: The patch fixes an issue in Elasticsearch where multiple datalinks for a single field were not being handled correctly. The `enhanceDataFrame` function was modified to properly filter and apply multiple datalinks based on a regular expression match of the field name. This ensures that all relevant datalinks are associated with the correct field in the data frame.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_cb27c9cd6f1e3304af56b33ae46ab44762d23132.patch

description: The patch addresses a potential open redirect vulnerability when opening a dashboard snapshot. The original URL of the snapshot was previously set on the client-side, which could be manipulated. The fix involves building the `originalUrl` on the backend and sanitizing/validating the URL before redirecting.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_d7dcea71ea763780dc286792a0afd560bff2985c.patch

description: This patch fixes an issue where plugin query help markdown was not being displayed correctly. The code was refactored to use a functional component with useAsync for loading the markdown. A message is displayed if the backend returns an empty string.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_db83d5f398caffe35c5846cfa7727d1a2a414165.patch

description: This patch addresses asynchronous mounting errors in the Grafana datasources. The changes involve updates to Elasticsearch DataLinks and Loki DerivedFields tests by wrapping their mount calls within 'act'. Additionally, the patch includes typecheck fixes and a minor strict-null fix.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_e11504dcd24bac55d6b7f26bfcb3a49122c2b35f.patch

description: The patch fixes an error that occurs when exporting dashboards using query variables that reference the default datasource. It handles undefined datasources during the export process. The issue was causing an error to be thrown during the export.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_e77602a3b9f381c21367a3103caf9f6b354dc4cc.patch

description: The patch introduces a feature to disable metric/label name lookup in Prometheus. This is intended to help users with large amounts of metric data that browsers cannot handle effectively. The change involves adding a switch in the datasource settings to disable the metrics lookup functionality, improving usability and performance for users with substantial metric data.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_f214005fe3b2d6d917914cba5f32ad000f2595ce.patch

description: The application displays a snapshot URL without proper sanitization. This could allow for a malicious URL to be displayed. The fix sanitizes the snapshot URL before displaying it.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_fb114a75241aaef4c08581b42509c750738b768a.patch

description: The patch addresses a potential XSS vulnerability by sanitizing Angular interpolation in URLs.  The original code used string replacement, which could be bypassed. The fix replaces all occurrences of '{{' and '}}' with their encoded equivalents using a global regular expression to prevent XSS attacks.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_fb85ed691290d211a5baa44d9a641ab137f0de88.patch

description: The patch fixes an issue in the Azure Monitor ArgQueryEditor where the subscription selector wasn't properly updating when data sources changed. This could lead to incorrect or missing data being displayed. The fix ensures that the correct subscription is selected and retained when the data source or query changes.
name: github.com_grafana_grafana_fc270ca11871c34ebb431665473e270599932a25.patch

description: The application generates HTML for a legend header without proper sanitization. By not escaping the 'name' variable, an attacker could inject malicious HTML/JavaScript code. This patch escapes the 'name' variable to prevent XSS.
name: github.com_grafana_piechart-panel_5c94f077738b8ab5af239d5b557bc9d64c7a1a45.patch

description: The legend header was not properly sanitized, leading to a potential XSS vulnerability. The patch escapes the header to prevent the injection of malicious code. This vulnerability occurs because the application uses unsanitized user input to construct HTML.
name: github.com_grafana_piechart-panel_d64b30c877dea907661a05cf46e5b75a7ebb6569.patch

description: This patch addresses a XSS vulnerability in GraphiQL that arises from using untrusted GraphQL server responses. The vulnerability allows code injection via malicious GraphQL type names during operation autocomplete. The fix involves HTML escaping, schema validation, and updating the markdown-it library.
name: github.com_graphql_graphiql_cb237eeeaf7333c4954c752122261db7520f7bf4.patch

description: This patch addresses an XSS vulnerability in GraphQL Playground when used with an untrusted GraphQL server. The vulnerability stems from unsanitized user input in the schema, allowing for code injection. The fix involves HTML escaping, schema validation, and using an up-to-date Markdown library to mitigate the risk.
name: github.com_graphql_graphql-playground_b8a956006835992f12c46b90384a79ab82bcadad.patch

description: The patch addresses a path traversal vulnerability in the file upload functionality. The vulnerability occurs because the application doesn't properly validate the file path, allowing attackers to potentially write files outside of the intended 'uploads' directory. The fix implements checks to prevent null bytes and ensure the file path stays within the allowed directory.
name: github.com_growthbook_growthbook_1a5edff8786d141161bf880c2fd9ccbe2850a264.patch

description: This patch deprecates the Server#start method in grpc-js. The start method is no longer needed and can be safely omitted. The patch also removes related checks and logic associated with the start method.
name: github.com_grpc_grpc-node_779e970099b155f92b54a594c1b40fcef4378031.patch

description: The application generates a development certificate, but the common name was not properly validated. The original regex allowed special characters, which could lead to unexpected behavior. The fix restricts the common name to alphanumeric characters and periods.
name: github.com_guybedford_devcert_571f4e6d077f7f21c6aed655ae380d85a7a5d3b8.patch

description: The patch introduces an `ownPropertyOnly` option to the LiquidJS template engine. This option prevents access to properties inherited from the prototype chain. It mitigates potential information disclosure or unexpected behavior when processing untrusted objects in LiquidJS templates, addressing issues like leaking JavaScript prototype getter functions.
name: github.com_harttle_liquidjs_7e99efc5131e20cf3f59e1fc2c371a15aa4109db.patch

description: The patch modifies the default value of `ownPropertyOnly` to `true`. This change affects how properties are accessed within the Liquid templating engine. By default, only own properties of an object will be accessed, which can prevent unintended access to inherited properties.
name: github.com_harttle_liquidjs_7eb621601c2b05d6e379e5ce42219f2b1f556208.patch

description: The patch modifies a regular expression used to determine if a request originates from a form element. By adding the 'i' flag to the regex, the check becomes case-insensitive, preventing a bypass of CSRF protection. This could lead to XSS if an attacker crafts a request with a different capitalization of the content-type header.
name: github.com_honojs_hono_41ce840379516410dee60c783142e05bb5a22449.patch

description: The patch fixes an issue in the trie-router where named parameters were being shared between requests. This could lead to a situation where a previous request's parameter value would be returned in a subsequent request. The fix ensures that each request receives its own set of parameters.
name: github.com_honojs_hono_8e2b6b08518998783f66d31db4f21b1b1eecc4c8.patch

description: The serveStatic middleware was vulnerable to path traversal. The vulnerability occurs because the middleware uses `decodeURI(url.pathname)` which can be manipulated to access files outside of the intended directory. The patch replaces `url.pathname` with `c.req.path` to mitigate the path traversal vulnerability.
name: github.com_honojs_hono_92e65fbb6e5e7372650e7690dbd84938432d9e65.patch

description: The code is vulnerable to host header injection. It doesn't validate the host header which can be exploited to redirect the user to a malicious website. The fix validates the host header and returns a 400 error if it is invalid.
name: github.com_honojs_node-server_306d98f02a8671a0a1fb91ac8fe7e281690c05af.patch

description: The patch addresses an issue where invalid host headers could cause the application to crash. The fix involves catching the `ERR_INVALID_URL` error, preventing unhandled exceptions. The changes ensure the server returns an error response instead of crashing when encountering a malformed host header.
name: github.com_honojs_node-server_d847e60249fd8183ba0998bc379ba20505643204.patch

description: The application is vulnerable to path traversal due to insufficient sanitization of the URL. The patch adds a check for "double dots" (../) in the URL path. It resolves the path using `node:path` to prevent accessing files outside the intended directory.
name: github.com_honojs_node-server_dd9b9a9b23e3896403c90a740e7f1f0892feb402.patch

description: The extension was vulnerable to XSS because it was accepting postMessage from any origin. The fix involves checking the origin of the message against a list of valid origins. If the origin is not in the list, the message is ignored.
name: github.com_hoppscotch_hoppscotch-extension_7e364b928ab722dc682d0fcad713a96cc38477d6.patch

description: The application was logging the database URL, which can contain sensitive information like credentials. This patch removes the logging of the database URL to prevent accidental exposure. This helps prevent unauthorized access to the database.
name: github.com_hoppscotch_hoppscotch_15424903ede20b155d764abf4c4f7c2c84c11247.patch

description: The patch modifies email templates to prevent possible links in email templates from being highlighted. It introduces a 'nohighlight' class to style links, removing default styling and cursor effects. This change aims to improve the user experience by preventing unintended link highlighting.
name: github.com_hoppscotch_hoppscotch_6827e97ec583b2534cdc1c2f33fa44973a0c2bf5.patch

description: The patch addresses a potential prototype pollution vulnerability in the QueryString utility. The vulnerability arises from how field names are parsed and injected into objects. By manipulating the field names, it might be possible to pollute the object prototype.
name: github.com_izatop_bunt_c55201a8cee03e5282f99874dead988c80d31db7.patch

description: The patch fixes a path traversal vulnerability when unpacking webpack bundles, specifically on Windows systems. It prevents writing files outside the intended directory by normalizing paths. The vulnerability occurs due to improper handling of relative paths in module identifiers.
name: github.com_j4k0xb_webcrack_4bc5c6f353012ee7edc2cb39d01a728ab7426999.patch

description: The patch removes a reflected XSS vulnerability in the dashboard. The vulnerability occurs because the application does not properly sanitize the dashboard name. This allows attackers to inject malicious code into the page.
name: github.com_jameswlane_status-board_19106617865406aa6f8edec036dcb1db427d5f71.patch

description: The patch removes reflected XSS vulnerability. The vulnerability was caused by directly embedding user-controlled data into the response without proper sanitization. This could allow an attacker to inject malicious scripts into the page.
name: github.com_jameswlane_status-board_1db3afd9332f5d743bc02143ae059bf21500600d.patch

description: The patch updates `logic.ts` to conform to linter rules, specifically addressing a `max-line-length` issue. The change modifies the error message sent in the response when a dashboard cannot be found. This update enhances code maintainability and readability.
name: github.com_jameswlane_status-board_d346d3e96b5baaaff4b52298dd0e994eb96b7411.patch

description: The application was vulnerable to path traversal via the Playwright screenshot functionality. An attacker could supply a `file://` URI to read arbitrary files from the server. The patch restricts the URL scheme to `http` or `https`, preventing unauthorized file access.
name: github.com_jasonraimondi_url-to-png_9336020c5e603323f5cf4a2ac3bb9a7735cf61f7.patch

description: The application constructs an image ID using unsanitized parameters. The `configToString` function's output is not sanitized, allowing for potential injection of unwanted characters into the `imageId`. This patch sanitizes the output of `configToString` by applying the `slugify` function.
name: github.com_jasonraimondi_url-to-png_e4eaeca6493b21cd515b582fd6c0af09ede54507.patch

description: The patch introduces a block list middleware to prevent requests to certain domains. This enhances security by allowing administrators to block access to potentially malicious or unwanted URLs. The block list is configured via the `BLOCK_LIST` environment variable.
name: github.com_jasonraimondi_url-to-png_f62ff40403ffa1781459d6be8d97b8035888c00c.patch

description: The extension allows configuring third-party command-line tools, which could enable attackers to run arbitrary binaries if they convince a user to open a malicious repository. The patch introduces a workspace trust feature to mitigate this risk. Workspace settings that determine tool locations are disabled by default in untrusted workspaces.
name: github.com_jbenden_vscode-c-cpp-flylint_2c842958f1dd49ed90a21e239b44d3afd22bb20e.patch

description: The iframe communication proxy allows attackers to listen to events sent to the iframe potentially leaking sensitive information. The fix introduces `sysend.channel()` which restricts cross-domain communication to only allowed domains, enhancing security. The `channel()` function should be called on the proxy iframe to limit the number of domains that can listen and send events.
name: github.com_jcubic_sysend.js_a24f4b776fb18191ae0f7e3d90c2c7bec459431a.patch

description: This patch introduces custom scrollbars for code blocks and styling tweaks to the editor. The changes mainly focus on improving the visual appearance and user experience of the code block component within the editor. No specific vulnerability is addressed in this patch.
name: github.com_jcv8000_Codex_64ecec8849c421c98af37eaccb2e2e461c77f6a6.patch

description: The patch fixes a CSRF vulnerability in the Azure AD plugin for Jenkins. The vulnerability exists because the GraphProxy endpoint was not protected by CSRF protection. The fix adds CSRF protection to the GraphProxy endpoint by including the crumb header and value in the request.
name: github.com_jenkinsci_azure-ad-plugin_8b1e80e6f242275127ebb177e2a755a2104b4853.patch

description: The patch adds HTML escaping to several components (EmojiArea, Preview, and Search) to prevent potential cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities. The application was vulnerable because it was directly inserting user-provided content into the DOM without proper sanitization. By escaping HTML entities, the patch ensures that potentially malicious code is rendered as text, mitigating the risk of XSS attacks.
name: github.com_joeattardi_emoji-button_fe54bef107eb3f74873a4018f2ff49fa124c6a2e.patch

description: The application was vulnerable to open redirect because it was possible to bypass the check for absolute URLs by adding leading whitespace. The patch changes the regex-based check to using the URL constructor. This ensures that absolute URLs including those with whitespace are correctly blocked.
name: github.com_johannschopplich_nuxt-api-party_72762a200fc19d997a0f84bce578c28698dc5270.patch

description: The patch removes unnecessary `@ts-expect-error` directives in the codebase. These directives were likely used to suppress TypeScript compiler errors related to generic type compatibility after upgrading to `@nuxt/module-builder`. Removing them suggests the underlying type issues have been resolved or addressed in a different way.
name: github.com_johannschopplich_nuxt-api-party_777462e1e3af1d9f8938aa33f230cd8cb6e0cc9a.patch

description: The patch addresses a potential DOM clobbering vulnerability by introducing an option to strip `name` and `id` attributes from untrusted HTML elements. Allowing these attributes could lead to XSS attacks. The Sanitizer class is updated to conditionally include or exclude these attributes based on the 'allowNamedProperties' setting.
name: github.com_jupyterlab_jupyterlab_06ad9de836f155add7d3d651ef936cc4c5ea8093.patch

description: The patch prevents path traversal vulnerabilities in several JupyterLab extensions. The vulnerability occurs due to the use of `URLExt.join` without proper validation, allowing attackers to manipulate URLs and access unauthorized resources. The fix ensures that the generated URLs stay within the intended base URL, preventing access to arbitrary paths.
name: github.com_jupyterlab_jupyterlab_19bd9b96cb2e77170a67e43121637d0b5619e8c6.patch

description: The patch removes the `action` attribute from `form` tags during sanitization. Leaving the action attribute in form tags allows attackers to inject malicious code via cross-site scripting (XSS). This change prevents the execution of untrusted code by sanitizing user-supplied HTML.
name: github.com_jupyterlab_jupyterlab_504825938c0abfa2fb8ff8d529308830a5ae42ed.patch

description: The patch addresses a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the table of contents (ToC) generation for Markdown headings. The vulnerability arises from improper sanitization and escaping of Markdown headings when creating IDs for ToC entries, potentially allowing an attacker to inject malicious scripts. The fix involves correctly sanitizing the heading content and using CSS.escape to ensure the generated IDs are safe for use in HTML attributes.
name: github.com_jupyterlab_jupyterlab_dda0033cd49449572d077bbecd33b18d8d05f48a.patch

description: The patch addresses a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the table of contents (ToC) generation for Markdown headings. The vulnerability arises from improper sanitization and escaping of Markdown headings when creating IDs for ToC entries. This allows for potential injection of malicious HTML code, leading to XSS attacks.
name: github.com_jupyterlab_jupyterlab_e1b3aabab603878e46add445a3114e838411d2df.patch

description: The patch addresses an improper authorization vulnerability in the email update functionality. Previously, users could change their email without providing their password. The fix requires users to provide their current password to validate the email update request.
name: github.com_kareadita_kavita_6648b79e1b2f92449d5816d0722b7a3d72f259d5.patch

description: The patch refactors the Keystone types to isolate base type definitions. This change improves code organization and maintainability. It doesn't directly address a specific vulnerability but may contribute to overall security by making the codebase easier to understand and audit.
name: github.com_keystonejs_keystone_4b019b8cfcb7bea6f800609da5d07e8c8abfc80a.patch

description: The patch modifies the esbuild configuration to explicitly target the 'node' platform. This change ensures the generated code is optimized and compatible with Node.js environments. The explicit platform specification improves reliability.
name: github.com_keystonejs_keystone_4ec75f388db8157f757307b828354caabd3bb669.patch

description: The patch fixes an authorization issue in Keystone 6 where `ui.isAccessAllowed` being `undefined` would grant access to the `adminMeta` GraphQL query. This is inconsistent with the default AdminUI `pageMiddleware` behavior, which should prevent access when `ui.isAccessAllowed` is not explicitly defined. The patch ensures that access is denied when `ui.isAccessAllowed` is undefined, aligning the behavior and preventing unauthorized access to admin metadata.
name: github.com_keystonejs_keystone_650e27e6e9b42abfb94c340c8470faf61f0ff284.patch

description: The patch fixes an issue where the multiselect field type in KeystoneJS was not correctly propagating common configuration options such as `label`, `access`, `graphql`, `isFilterable`, and `isOrderable`. This resulted in the field not behaving as expected based on the provided configuration. The fix ensures that these options are properly applied to the multiselect field.
name: github.com_keystonejs_keystone_65c6ee3deef23605fc72b80230908696a7a65e7c.patch

description: The patch addresses an open redirect vulnerability. The vulnerability exists because the `from` query parameter in the signin page URL is not properly validated, potentially leading to redirection to an arbitrary URL after login. The fix ensures that the `from` parameter is only added to the URL when it's needed and redirects to a safe default.
name: github.com_keystonejs_keystone_96bf833a23b1a0a5d365cf394467a943cc481b38.patch

description: The patch removes redirect functionality from the `/signin` page to prevent open redirection vulnerability. An open redirect vulnerability occurs when an application uses untrusted input to construct a URL. Attackers can exploit this by crafting malicious links that redirect users to phishing sites or other malicious destinations.
name: github.com_keystonejs_keystone_a30c7a1630a670eb814e015254c7ae608500b2d8.patch

description: The patch adds a test case to verify that `process.env.NODE_ENV` is correctly set to 'production' when running in a production environment. This ensures that the application behaves as expected in production. The fix ensures the consistency of the environment variable.
name: github.com_keystonejs_keystone_d07f20ab3f22ba3a5c34f309018014bcae6340a7.patch

description: The application was displaying error messages from URL parameters directly in the UI. These URL parameters (`error`, `error_description`, and `openid_error`) could be spoofed, leading to a potential XSS vulnerability. The patch modifies the application to log the specific error messages but only display generic error messages to the user.
name: github.com_kiali_kiali_aab7694f850f04d7fd875fac5f720a93ccdf01ad.patch

description: The patch fixes a path traversal vulnerability in the `git` function. The function previously did not check if the provided file path exists before passing it to the `execa.sync` function, which executes the `git blame` command. This could allow an attacker to trigger an error by providing a non-existent path, potentially leading to denial of service or information disclosure.
name: github.com_kucherenko_blamer_0965877f115753371a2570f10a63c455d2b2cde3.patch

description: The application renders user-provided content without proper sanitization. This can lead to XSS attacks where malicious scripts are injected into the page. The fix involves using DOMPurify to sanitize the HTML before rendering it in the ChatMessageBubble component.
name: github.com_langchain-ai_chat-langchain_e13db53cba2a48e4e26d103fd51598856f6bdd33.patch

description: The patch implements CSRF protection by adding a token to forms and validating it on the server-side. This prevents attackers from forging requests on behalf of authenticated users. The application generates a unique CSRF token for each user session, embeds it in forms as a hidden field, and verifies the token when processing POST/PUT requests.
name: github.com_laurent22_joplin_19b45de2981c09f6f387498ef96d32b4811eba5e.patch

description: The patch disallows the use of `<map>` and `<area>` tags. The `area` tag's links were not properly sanitized, which could allow for sandbox escapes. By disallowing these tags, the vulnerability is mitigated.
name: github.com_laurent22_joplin_7c52c3e9a81a52ef1b42a951f9deb9d378d59b0f.patch

description: The patch fixes a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Joplin desktop application. The vulnerability exists in the `stripHtml` function, which is used to sanitize HTML input. The fix re-encodes "<" characters to prevent HTML injection and mitigate XSS attacks.
name: github.com_laurent22_joplin_810018b41f4d9f0c2fd9af4b8fd332fa4a0210f0.patch

description: This patch introduces proxy support to the application. It configures proxy settings such as proxy URL, timeout, and concurrent connections. The patch doesn't fix a vulnerability, but adds functionality.
name: github.com_laurent22_joplin_8bb5b4a557f2a46f300b79745982788c59f765f7.patch

description: The patch addresses a potential XSS vulnerability. The vulnerability stems from the improper sanitization of HTML input. By adding `noscript` to the list of disallowed tags, the application prevents the execution of potentially malicious scripts embedded within these tags.
name: github.com_laurent22_joplin_9c20d5947d1fa4678a8b640792ff3d31224f0adf.patch

description: The patch addresses a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability by sanitizing HTML attributes, specifically the `href` attribute. It ensures that only acceptable URLs are allowed, filtering out potentially malicious `javascript:` URLs. The vulnerability could allow attackers to inject arbitrary code.
name: github.com_laurent22_joplin_9e90d9016daf79b5414646a93fd369aedb035071.patch

description: The application is vulnerable to XSS. A specially crafted string passed to the renderer can execute arbitrary JavaScript. The fix involves encoding the language attribute of the `<pre>` tag to prevent the injection.
name: github.com_laurent22_joplin_a2de167b95debad83a0f0c7925a88c0198db812e.patch

description: The patch addresses a vulnerability in the htmlparser2 library that allowed tags to start with non-alphanumeric characters. This could lead to XSS attacks if an attacker could inject malicious HTML containing such tags. The fix ensures that tag names must start with ASCII alpha characters, preventing the execution of arbitrary code.
name: github.com_laurent22_joplin_b220413a9b5ed55fb1f565ac786a5c231da8bc87.patch

description: The patch disables SVG tag support in the editor to prevent potential XSS vulnerabilities. SVG tags can be used to inject malicious JavaScript. The vulnerability occurs because the application does not properly sanitize SVG tags in user-provided content.
name: github.com_laurent22_joplin_caf66068bfc474bbfd505013076ed173cd90ca83.patch

description: The commit filters out form elements from the note body to prevent potential XSS vulnerabilities.  Specifically, tags such as button, form, input, select, and textarea are disallowed. This prevents attackers from injecting malicious scripts into notes through form elements.
name: github.com_laurent22_joplin_feaecf765368f2c273bea3a9fa641ff0da7e6b26.patch

description: The patch addresses a security issue in isolated-vm related to accessing properties of objects via `Reference` functions. It prevents invoking accessors (getters/setters) or proxies through `reference.get` and related methods. This change aims to avoid unexpected side effects or security vulnerabilities that could arise from interacting with these potentially malicious or sensitive object features within the isolated environment.
name: github.com_laverdet_isolated-vm_2646e6c1558bac66285daeab54c7d490ed332b15.patch

description: The patch addresses a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the comment functionality. User-provided comment text was not properly sanitized before being rendered, potentially allowing malicious scripts to be injected. The fix involves sanitizing the HTML content of comments on both the backend and frontend using the `sanitizeHtml` utility.
name: github.com_lightdash_lightdash_3b37c25096158eb1e069fc5263b776ba23c12c61.patch

description: The patch addresses a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the handling of markdown tile content. User-provided markdown content was not properly sanitized, potentially allowing attackers to inject malicious scripts. The patch introduces sanitization of the markdown content using a configured ruleset to prevent XSS attacks.
name: github.com_lightdash_lightdash_6ad577e92643a7e901f4bd981ee0f6ac8cf9fd0e.patch

description: The application was setting cookies using `setExtraHTTPHeaders`, which could leak the cookie to other domains. The fix involves setting the cookie directly using `setCookie` with specified domain and sameSite attributes. The cookie value is extracted and validated before being set.
name: github.com_lightdash_lightdash_d34802a6d25c2aa82ac6debb60f35be3667a0596.patch

description: The application is vulnerable to path traversal. It is possible to access arbitrary files on the system by manipulating the `fileId` and `imageId` parameters. The patch adds validation and sanitization to prevent path traversal attacks.
name: github.com_lightdash_lightdash_fcc808c84c2cc3afb343063e32a49440d32a553c.patch

description: The patch modifies how user data is sent to the `/api/companies/${company.code}/users` endpoint. It adds logic to handle cases where `isNewConsole` is true, potentially related to user data validation or formatting. This change might address improper validation of user inputs during the invitation process.
name: github.com_linagora_twake_0770da3b184b5d5e71fee8251a5847a04c7cb9bc.patch

description: The patch addresses a potential timeout issue during the migration of drive files. A timeout is added to prevent the migration process from hanging indefinitely when processing file versions. This change improves the reliability of the drive migration process.
name: github.com_linagora_twake_599f397561a771251dfc7cafb8cecda5ab22b8b3.patch

description: The patch mitigates a potential XSS vulnerability by sanitizing URLs before rendering them in the application's frontend. The vulnerability occurs because the application does not properly validate or sanitize URLs, allowing an attacker to inject malicious JavaScript code through the `javascript:` protocol. The fix involves adding a `.replace(/^javascript:/, '')` to remove the javascript: prefix from URLs before they are rendered as links.
name: github.com_linagora_twake_61f4c0caf4ce61c839fb304a707972974daacae9.patch

description: The patch fixes an authorization issue in the plugin gateway. It introduces a checkAuth function that validates the access code against a list of allowed access codes.  If the access code is invalid, an error response is returned, preventing unauthorized access to the plugin gateway.
name: github.com_lobehub_lobe-chat_2184167f09ab68e4efa051ee984ea0c4e7c48fbd.patch

description: The application has an internal proxy endpoint `/api/proxy`. The proxy endpoint is vulnerable to SSRF because it does not validate the hostname. This patch adds validation to prevent proxying to internal hosts.
name: github.com_lobehub_lobe-chat_465665a735556669ee30446c7ea9049a20cc7c37.patch

description: The patch addresses a Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability in the proxy functionality. The original implementation used `dns.lookup` to check the hostname, but this was insufficient to prevent SSRF. The fix replaces the old proxy route with a new implementation utilizing the `request-filtering-agent` package to better prevent proxying to internal hosts.
name: github.com_lobehub_lobe-chat_e960a23b0c69a5762eb27d776d33dac443058faf.patch

description: The patch removes the 'Gistpad > Api Url' setting. This setting allowed users to specify a custom GitHub API URL, but it's no longer supported after migrating to VS Code's native authentication. Removing the setting simplifies configuration and eliminates a potential source of errors.
name: github.com_lostintangent_gistpad_230b05e8dea8d7ac5aae998bbe0a591d7f081b70.patch

description: The patch addresses an improper authorization vulnerability. The application was missing access control checks for certain dataset and prompt modification endpoints. This allowed unauthorized users to potentially modify or delete data they should not have access to.
name: github.com_lunary-ai_lunary_0755dde1afc2a74ec23b55eee03e4416916cf48f.patch

description: The application was missing authorization checks when deleting a dataset. Any user could delete any dataset by specifying its ID. The fix adds an authorization check and ensures that only authorized users can delete datasets.
name: github.com_lunary-ai_lunary_14078c1d2b8766075bf655f187ece24c7a787776.patch

description: The patch fixes an improper authorization vulnerability in the SAML integration. The /download-idp-xml and /acs endpoints were missing authorization checks to ensure that the user belongs to the correct organization. This allows users from different organizations to potentially modify or access sensitive SAML configurations or login.
name: github.com_lunary-ai_lunary_1f043d8798ad87346dfe378eea723bff78ad7433.patch

description: The application was configured to allow all origins via CORS. This is mitigated by restricting the allowed origin to the application URL in production. In development, all origins are still allowed.
name: github.com_lunary-ai_lunary_3451fcd7b9d95e9091d62c515752f39f2faa6e54.patch

description: The patch fixes an authorization issue in the related runs endpoint. The query to fetch related runs did not include a check for the project ID. This allowed users to potentially access runs from other projects.
name: github.com_lunary-ai_lunary_35afd4439464571eb016318cd7b6f85a162225ca.patch

description: The patch fixes an improper authorization vulnerability in the dataset API. The API endpoints for retrieving, deleting, and patching dataset prompt variations were not checking if the user had access to the project the dataset belonged to. This allowed users to potentially access or modify data they were not authorized to.
