This patch adds validation to ensure the references provided match the expected extra keys in the transfer instructions. Failure to validate references could lead to unexpected behavior or exploitation.
name: github.com_solana-labs_solana-pay_ac6ce0d0a81137700874a8bf5a7caac3be999fad.patch

description: The code introduces `guardedShift` and `guardedSplice` functions to prevent out-of-bounds access when reading from byte arrays during deserialization. This prevents errors that occur when the buffer ends unexpectedly. The changes ensure that deserialization processes handle potentially malformed or truncated data more gracefully.
name: github.com_solana-labs_solana-web3.js_77d935221a4805107b20b60ae7c1148725e4e2d0.patch

description: Custom commands were overriding default commands with the same name. The order of adding custom prompts and default prompts to allCommands map is swapped to prioritize default prompts. This change ensures that built-in commands are not overridden by custom ones.
name: github.com_sourcegraph_cody_0a178b0117e0328a12a7b556995da6d0ba773da5.patch

description: The patch disables browser autocompletion suggestions in the CodeMirror search component. This is to prevent noisy or irrelevant suggestions while typing queries. The `autocomplete` attribute is set to 'off' to achieve this.
name: github.com_sourcegraph_sourcegraph_a44b3b6bc5a9a3a8fd00463717ba9d1eb0cad3f0.patch

description: The patch prevents Personal Access Tokens (PATs) from being created with the `tokens:write` scope, which could allow a PAT to create more tokens. This restricts the ability of a PAT to escalate its privileges by creating other tokens with potentially higher permissions. The fix involves modifying the token creation logic on the server to check for and reject tokens with the restricted scope.
name: github.com_specklesystems_speckle-server_3689e1cd58ec4f06abee836af34889d6ce474571.patch

description: The patch adds antiforgery tokens to forms in multiple views and controllers, including Account, Profile, and Setup controllers. This prevents Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) attacks by ensuring that requests originate from the application's legitimate user interface. The `AutoValidateAntiforgeryToken` attribute is added to controllers, and `@Html.AntiForgeryToken()` is added to forms to protect against CSRF.
name: github.com_squidex_squidex_2da3c41da82eb945832f22bb70dba567ac6ce969.patch

description: The patch escapes HTML in markdown to prevent XSS vulnerabilities. The markdown library was not properly escaping HTML entities, which could allow attackers to inject malicious scripts. The fix ensures that all HTML entities are properly escaped before rendering the markdown.
name: github.com_squidex_squidex_cf4efc52eab17098474d73ccff6c136fc2f737db.patch

description: The code did not validate that the `options.varName` was a valid Javascript identifier. This could potentially lead to issues if an invalid identifier was used. The patch adds a check to ensure that the `options.varName` is a valid JS identifier.
name: github.com_squirrellyjs_squirrelly_426f930e5ca1501404cd887071e734ec5feb0bcf.patch

description: The patch removes the merging of `data.settings` into the config option. This prevents unexpected behavior where user-provided settings could override or interfere with the application's configuration. By removing this functionality, the application's configuration becomes more predictable and secure.
name: github.com_squirrellyjs_squirrelly_c12418a026f73df645ba927fd29358efe02fed1e.patch

description: The patch removes the copying of properties from `data.settings['view options']` to the configuration. This could potentially prevent unintended modification of the configuration by user-supplied data. It improves security by isolating the configuration from potentially malicious input.
name: github.com_squirrellyjs_squirrelly_dca7a1e7ee91d8a6ffffb655f3f15647486db9da.patch

description: The patch addresses a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the mind-elixir project. The vulnerability arises from improper sanitization of user-supplied input, allowing attackers to inject malicious scripts into the application's interface. The fix involves encoding HTML entities to prevent the execution of injected scripts.
name: github.com_ssshooter_mind-elixir-core_073485269ac83af24371f35bd08507defa885655.patch

description: The patch removes reflected XSS in the dashboard.ts file. The application was vulnerable to XSS due to unsanitized dashboard name being used in the error message. The fix involves removing the dashboard name from the error message.
name: github.com_status-board_status-board_19106617865406aa6f8edec036dcb1db427d5f71.patch

description: The patch prevents Javascript from accessing the mnemonic phrase through a private API. The vulnerability allowed unauthorized access to sensitive mnemonic phrases, potentially leading to compromised user accounts. The fix involves modifying API endpoints and components to ensure secure handling of mnemonic phrases.
name: github.com_stellar_freighter_81f78ba008c41ce631a3d0f9e4449f4bbd90baee.patch

description: The application's `readChallengeTx` function did not properly verify that the server account had signed the challenge transaction. This allowed potentially malicious transactions to be processed without proper server authorization. The fix ensures the server's signature is verified.
name: github.com_stellar_js-stellar-sdk_6f0bb889c2d10b431ddd5f4a1bcdd519c80430b3.patch

description: The patch prevents command injection by disallowing the use of `--upload-pack` as a command in `git.clone`. This prevents potential accidental command execution. The vulnerability arises from how user-supplied arguments are passed to the `git clone` command.
name: github.com_steveukx_git-js_2040de601c894363050fef9f28af367b169a56c5.patch

description: The patch prevents command injection in the `git.fetch` command. Specifically, it blocks the use of the `--upload-pack` option which could potentially be exploited to execute arbitrary commands. The fix involves checking for and disallowing this option in the arguments passed to the `git fetch` command.
name: github.com_steveukx_git-js_372efa0f5efacb49cfb60703b6adb8b2e58ed9f8.patch

description: The patch prevents command injection in `git.fetch` by disallowing the use of the `--upload-pack` option. This option could be exploited to execute arbitrary commands. The vulnerability is addressed by blocking the potentially malicious argument.
name: github.com_steveukx_git-js_d119ec44222796cf14f6dde60bf8c40931b5a125.patch

description: The patch prevents command injection by blocking the use of `git push --exec` and similar commands without explicit user approval. This prevents attackers from executing arbitrary commands on the server when `git push` is used with malicious parameters. The vulnerability arises from passing user-supplied parameters directly to git commands.
name: github.com_steveukx_git-js_ec97a39ab60b89e870c5170121cd9c1603cc1951.patch

description: The patch fixes an issue where the modal was closed even when an error occurred during the release update. This behavior was incorrect, as the user should be informed of the error and be able to correct it. The fix prevents the modal from closing on error, improving the user experience.
name: github.com_strapi_strapi_a0da7e73e1496d835fe71a2febb14f70170135c7.patch

description: The patch addresses a validation issue in the Content-Type Builder. It ensures that component names are checked against existing collection type names during component creation. This prevents potential naming conflicts and data integrity issues.
name: github.com_strapi_strapi_e1dfd4d9f1cab25cf6da3614c1975e4e508e01c6.patch

description: The patch fixes a potential XSS vulnerability in the survey-creator-core package. The vulnerability occurs when pasting plain text into a string editor, where `document.execCommand("insertHTML"` was used. This allowed arbitrary HTML, including scripts, to be inserted, and the patch replaces it with `document.execCommand("insertText"` to prevent script execution.
name: github.com_surveyjs_survey-creator_b7a150c520a1b7a589f09d0db56af105a85e8166.patch

description: The patch addresses a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the handling of YouTube video URLs within the `QuestionImageModel`. The vulnerability arises because the application did not properly validate the imageLink property when contentMode is set to 'youtube', allowing execution of arbitrary javascript. The fix involves sanitizing the URL to prevent the execution of malicious scripts.
name: github.com_surveyjs_survey-library_b25fbf0efd4486dc55f836240bebc2305803b96d.patch

description: The application was vulnerable to XSS due to improper attribute escaping during server-side rendering (SSR). Specifically, the `escape_attribute_value` function and `add_attribute` function were not properly escaping certain characters in attribute values, leading to potential injection of malicious code. This patch fixes this by ensuring that all attribute values are properly escaped.
name: github.com_sveltejs_svelte_f8605d6acbf66976da9b4547f76e90e163899907.patch

description: The code had a bug where signatures were only compared up to the length of the shorter signature. This allowed attackers to pass a partial signature and bypass verification. The fix ensures that the length of the signature is also taken into account during comparison, preventing the vulnerability.
name: github.com_svix_svix-webhooks_958821bd3b956d1436af65f70a0964d4ffb7daf6.patch

description: The patch addresses a regular expression denial of service (ReDoS) vulnerability. It introduces a `TimedMatch` utility to safely execute regular expressions with a time limit. This prevents attackers from crafting regular expressions that consume excessive resources, leading to denial of service.
name: github.com_switcherapi_switcher-client-master_374752563d6ce9353ee592b40c809c8136f24930.patch

description: The application was vulnerable to XSS because it did not validate URLs before embedding them in iframes. This patch adds checks to ensure that URLs start with 'http://' or 'https://' to prevent execution of arbitrary JavaScript. The vulnerability is fixed by validating URL schemas to prevent XSS attacks.
name: github.com_syuilo_misskey_38f9d1e76428bea47c5944c440eab25428c7d99e.patch

description: The patch adds missing 'kind' definitions to several admin endpoints. This 'kind' definition is likely used for access control, and its absence could lead to unauthorized access to sensitive administrative functions. By adding these definitions, the application ensures that proper authorization checks are performed before granting access to these endpoints.
name: github.com_syuilo_misskey_5150053275594278e9eb23e72d98b16593c4c230.patch

description: The patch fixes an improper authorization vulnerability in the job queue management screen. An attacker could bypass authentication to access the job queue management interface. The vulnerability is located in the `ClientServerService.ts` file.
name: github.com_syuilo_misskey_c9aeccb2ab260ceedc126e6e366da8cd13ece4b2.patch

description: The patch adds a check to prevent downloading files from private IP addresses. The vulnerability arises because the application was not validating the IP address of the URL to be downloaded, which could allow an attacker to perform a Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) attack. The fix involves checking if the resolved IP address is a private IP and blocking the download if it is.
name: github.com_syuilo_misskey_e1a8b158e04ad567d92d8daf3cc0898ee18f1a2e.patch

description: The code is vulnerable to SQL injection in the `search-by-tag` endpoint.  The vulnerability occurs because the code does not properly sanitize the tag before using it in a SQL query. This can allow an attacker to inject arbitrary SQL code into the query, potentially leading to data breaches or other malicious activities.
name: github.com_syuilo_misskey_ee74df68233adcd5b167258c621565f97c3b2306.patch

description: This patch adds a reverse lookup function `preferredExtension()` to the mime package. It allows retrieving the preferred file extension based on a given MIME type. The patch also includes type declarations and a missing tsconfig file for a conversion tool, improving code quality and maintainability.
name: github.com_thi-ng_umbrella_88f61656e5f5cfba960013b8133186389efaf243.patch

description: The patch addresses a potential prototype pollution vulnerability in the `thi.ng/paths` library. The `toPath()` function now performs stricter validation on input paths to prevent prototype pollution attacks. The `disallowProtoPath()` function is used to check for unsafe paths and throws an error if any are found.
name: github.com_thi-ng_umbrella_c78b484882ad5214a46ef83ddb8020571c171353.patch

description: The patch removes search configuration, including the search indexer token, from being written to the tina-lock.json file. This prevents sensitive information from being inadvertently exposed. The vulnerability occurs during the generation of the configuration file.
name: github.com_tinacms_tinacms_110f1ceea4574d636a64526648f7c8bf6539b26a.patch

description: The patch addresses a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability related to parsing content within iframe elements. The vulnerability occurs because the parser incorrectly parses the content of iframe elements. This patch ensures that content within iframes is treated as text, preventing the execution of potentially malicious scripts.
name: github.com_tinymce_tinymce_2b71c922214d388838d930806207a66c14e80f63.patch

description: The patch fixes two XSS vulnerabilities in TinyMCE. The first is caused by double decoding of HTML entities in `noscript` elements. The second involves the `noneditable_regexp` option, where XSS HTML could be injected even if it didn't fully match the regexp.
name: github.com_tinymce_tinymce_5acb741665a98e83d62b91713c800abbff43b00d.patch

description: The application was vulnerable to XSS in the `WindowManager.alert` and `WindowManager.confirm` APIs. HTML in messages was not properly sanitized, leading to potential execution of malicious scripts. The fix sanitizes the HTML using DOMPurify.
name: github.com_tinymce_tinymce_6923d85eba6de3e08ebc9c5a387b5abdaa21150e.patch

description: The patch addresses a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in TinyMCE. The vulnerability exists because the `WindowManager.alert` and `WindowManager.confirm` APIs were not properly sanitizing HTML messages. The fix implements HTML sanitization using DOMPurify to prevent the execution of malicious scripts within alert and confirm dialogs.
name: github.com_tinymce_tinymce_8bb2d2646d4e1a718fce61a775fa22e9d317b32d.patch

description: The patch introduces two new options, `sandbox_iframes` and `convert_unsafe_embeds`, to mitigate potential XSS vulnerabilities. The `sandbox_iframes` option adds a `sandbox` attribute to iframe elements, restricting their capabilities. The `convert_unsafe_embeds` option converts `<object>` and `<embed>` elements to safer alternatives based on their MIME types, providing better control over potentially malicious content.
name: github.com_tinymce_tinymce_bcdea2ad14e3c2cea40743fb48c63bba067ae6d1.patch

description: The patch introduces a `safe_output` option to sanitize filenames before setting them as output, mitigating command injection vulnerabilities.  The vulnerability occurs because the action uses the output of git commands directly in shell commands. The fix involves sanitizing special characters like `$()|&;` to prevent arbitrary code execution.
name: github.com_tj-actions_changed-files_0102c07446a3cad972f4afcbd0ee4dbc4b6d2d1b.patch

description: The patch addresses a SAML signature wrapping vulnerability. The code now throws an error if any signature verification fails. It also includes checks to prevent wrapping attacks by validating the signature reference URI against the expected assertion ID.
name: github.com_tngan_samlify_d382bbc7c6b8ea889839ae1f178730c25b09eb42.patch

description: The patch fixes an improper authorization vulnerability in the Tolgee translation endpoints. Previously, API keys were not properly checked for the necessary scopes, allowing unauthorized access to translations. The fix ensures that the necessary project permissions are checked before allowing access to translation data.
name: github.com_tolgee_tolgee-platform_f71213925d6f80019f841db0ead9baa7488c1821.patch

description: The patch mitigates prototype pollution by preventing the assignment of values to `__proto__`, `constructor`, and `prototype` properties. It checks if the key is in the `invalids` array and skips the assignment if it is. This prevents attackers from manipulating object prototypes and potentially causing denial-of-service or other security issues.
name: github.com_tony-tsx_cookiex-deep_b5bea2b7f34a5fa9abb4446cbd038ecdbcd09c88.patch

description: The application lacked proper validation for the size of uploaded avatar files. This could lead to denial of service by allowing users to upload very large files, consuming server resources. A maximum file size limit has been added to prevent this.
name: github.com_tooljet_tooljet_01cd3f0464747973ec329e9fb1ea12743d3235cc.patch

description: The application was exposing user data (likely PII) when retrieving threads. The fix modifies the query to specifically select which user fields are returned, limiting the exposure of sensitive information. This prevents unintentional disclosure of user details.
name: github.com_tooljet_tooljet_37bf6de75f161e03c2a81888810488b913863a46.patch

description: The patch addresses an issue where user data was inadvertently exposed in the comments module. The original code eagerly loaded user data with comments, which included sensitive information. The fix modifies the queries to selectively retrieve specific user details (id, firstName, lastName) and avoids exposing all user data.
name: github.com_tooljet_tooljet_45e0d3302d92df7d7f2d609c31cea71165600b79.patch

description: The API endpoint for retrieving users with group permissions was exposing more user data than necessary. The query has been updated to only select the user ID, first name, last name, and email. This change reduces the risk of accidental exposure of sensitive user information.
name: github.com_tooljet_tooljet_7879d8a76000c014533a97a22bc276afe3ae3e54.patch

description: The patch addresses an improper authorization vulnerability related to unarchiving users. It ensures that users can only be unarchived if their status is 'archived'. The code now prevents unarchiving a user if the user's status is not archived, returning a 400 error.
name: github.com_tooljet_tooljet_b9fa229bcae356cbb33300b31483e97e6ea140a7.patch

description: The patch addresses a command injection vulnerability in Tridactyl. Malicious web pages could send artificial key events to the parsers, potentially executing shell commands if the native messenger was installed. The fix involves checking the `isTrusted` property of KeyboardEvents to prevent untrusted events from being processed.
name: github.com_tridactyl_tridactyl_0faf4be41aa032e4945ecec49fb5c20365fa2060.patch

description: This patch introduces support for AES-256-CTR encryption to enhance the security of stored keys. It addresses a cryptographic issue by adding a stronger encryption option.  The patch modifies several files to incorporate the new encryption algorithm and related functionalities.
name: github.com_trustwallet_wallet-core_69b2da9826dfdeb8116be1e5a3747b3e9418592d.patch

description: This patch introduces constants related to error reporting client types. It defines an enum `ErrorReportClientType` with values for Browser, Android, iOS, macOS, Linux, and Windows. This appears to be adding functionality rather than fixing a vulnerability.
name: github.com_tutao_tutanota_2939aa9f4356f0dc9f523ee5ce19d09e08ab979b.patch

description: The patch adds a warning message when opening potentially suspicious links in the desktop client. It checks if the URL protocol is neither 'http' nor 'https' and shows a warning dialog to the user before opening the link. This helps prevent users from accidentally executing potentially malicious programs.
name: github.com_tutao_tutanota_88ecad17d00d05a722399aed35f0d280899d55a2.patch

description: This patch focuses on code style consistency by removing unnecessary spaces. The change improves code readability and maintainability. This does not address any specific vulnerability.
name: github.com_typeorm_typeorm_56089567309cafab51257d2a66c4acfb77cff59b.patch

description: The patch addresses prototype pollution vulnerabilities. It prevents properties named '__proto__' or 'constructor' from being processed during object transformation. This avoids unintended modification of the Object prototype, mitigating potential security risks.
name: github.com_typestack_class-transformer_8f04eb9db02de708f1a20f6f2d2bb309b2fed01e.patch

description: The patch hardens the media embed element against XSS vulnerabilities. It explicitly prohibits `javascript:` protocol when parsing URLs in `useMediaState`. The `url` return value of `useMediaState` is renamed to `unsafeUrl` to indicate it is not sanitized.
name: github.com_udecode_plate_1bc0971774fbfb770780c9bdb94746a6f0f196a0.patch

description: The patch introduces a `sanitizeUrl` utility and uses it to validate and sanitize URLs, preventing potential XSS vulnerabilities. The vulnerability stems from the lack of proper URL sanitization when handling links, allowing potentially malicious JavaScript URLs. The fix ensures that only allowed URL schemes are used.
name: github.com_udecode_plate_93dd5712854660874900ae12e4d8e6ff28089eb7.patch

description: The patch addresses an XSS vulnerability in `@urql/next` by escaping HTML characters in JSON payloads injected into RSC hydration bodies. Failure to escape these characters allowed attackers to manipulate strings in the JSON response, leading to potential execution of arbitrary HTML. The fix involves using `htmlEscapeJsonString` to sanitize the JSON data before injecting it into the stream.
name: github.com_urql-graphql_urql_4b7011b70d5718728ff912d02a4dbdc7f703540d.patch

description: The patch updates the `echo` framework's `Secure` middleware configuration to mitigate potential XSS attacks. It sets `XSSProtection` to '1; mode=block' and `ContentTypeNosniff` to 'nosniff', enabling browser-side XSS filtering and preventing MIME-sniffing vulnerabilities. It also introduces a `DefaultGetRequestSkipper` function to skip security checks for GET requests, potentially reducing overhead.
name: github.com_usememos_memos_46c13a4b7f675b92d297df6dabb4441f13c7cd9c.patch

description: The patch removes instances of `escape` from the `marked` function calls within several parsers (Bold, BoldEmphasis, Emphasis, Link). It also reintroduces `escape` on the `Strikethrough` parser. This prevents double escaping and mitigates potential XSS vulnerabilities by ensuring user input is properly sanitized before rendering in the browser.
name: github.com_usememos_memos_64e5c343c5f74b0abdf3ac0d21a6139daea58cf8.patch

description: The patch adds escaping to prevent XSS vulnerabilities. It utilizes the `escape` function from the lodash library to sanitize user inputs before rendering them in HTML. Specifically, the patch modifies the `SearchBar`, `highlighter`, `Bold`, `BoldEmphasis`, `Emphasis`, and `Link` components to escape potentially malicious content.
name: github.com_usememos_memos_65cc19c12efa392f792f6bb154b4838547e0af5e.patch

description: The patch fixes a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the marked renderer. The vulnerability occurs because the application does not properly sanitize user-supplied input when rendering markdown. By adding `PlainText` to the allowed components during parsing, the application mitigates XSS.
name: github.com_usememos_memos_7670c9536000bb32c6345d4906a91268dcddd5fc.patch

description: The patch adds the `Secure` attribute to the session cookie. This ensures that the cookie is only sent over HTTPS. Without this attribute, the cookie could be intercepted over an insecure connection.
name: github.com_usememos_memos_7efa749c6628c75b19a912ca170529f5c293bb2e.patch

description: The patch validates external links to prevent open redirect vulnerabilities. It ensures that external links start with "http" to avoid redirecting users to potentially malicious sites. This validation is performed during resource creation to mitigate the risk of unauthorized redirects.
name: github.com_usememos_memos_b11d2130a084385eb65c3761a3c841ebe9f81ae8.patch

description: The patch stores the Spring CSRF token in meta tags in the bootstrap page, which is used for login() and logout() helpers. This protects login and logout functionality against CSRF attacks, eliminating the need to ignore Spring CSRF protection for the /login endpoint. The vulnerability is fixed by adding CSRF tokens to requests.
name: github.com_vaadin_flow_815b967fc84fefa8d3a4d72b9a036f48b0d96326.patch

description: The application was exposing the JWT token to form.io, potentially leading to unauthorized access or data leakage. The fix sets Formio's `projectUrl` and `authUrl` to the current origin instead of `api.form.io`. Additionally, the user is now set in Formio to prevent calls to the `/current` endpoint.
name: github.com_valtimo-platform_valtimo-frontend-libraries_1aaba5ef5750dafebbc7476fb08bf2375a25f19e.patch

description: The patch addresses a vulnerability where the JWT token was exposed to form.io. The `projectUrl` and `authUrl` are now set to the current origin, preventing the usage of api.form.io as a default. Additionally, the user is now set in Formio to avoid calls to the `/current` endpoint which could leak the token.
name: github.com_valtimo-platform_valtimo-frontend-libraries_8c2dbf2a41180d2b0358d878290e4d37168f0fb6.patch

description: The application was using `api.form.io` as a default URL. This commit sets Formio's `projectUrl` and `authUrl` to the current origin. Also, it sets the user in Formio so that the `/current` endpoint is no longer called.
name: github.com_valtimo-platform_valtimo-frontend-libraries_d65e05fd2784bd4a628778b34a5b79ce2f0cef8c.patch

description: The application previously allowed any URL to be opened in the main electron window using the 'element://' protocol. This patch restricts the URLs that can be opened to only the main application page, specifically 'vector://vector/webapp/'. This prevents potential open redirect vulnerabilities where malicious URLs could be loaded within the application's context.
name: github.com_vector-im_element-desktop_89b1e39b801655e595337708d4319ba4313feafa.patch

description: A malicious SVG file could execute javascript when opened in a new tab. The vulnerability is mitigated by adding a Content Security Policy header to responses. This prevents the browser from executing arbitrary scripts embedded in the SVG file.
name: github.com_vendure-ecommerce_vendure_69a44869112c0a5b836e2ddd3969ea9b533f51f0.patch

description: This patch introduces server components in Next.js. It involves modifications to the build process, webpack loaders, client-side rendering, and server-side rendering to support the new server component feature. The changes ensure proper rendering and handling of server components in both development and production environments.
name: github.com_vercel_next.js_00a843280d340862dabcbf96248acf95c0957627.patch

description: The patch addresses a bug where the Edge SSR loader was missing the global process injection (`enhanceGlobals`). The changes also include cleaning up imports, removing unused code, and converting some imports to type imports. This ensures the proper environment is available.
name: github.com_vercel_next.js_0831dd59c98e3f7a6faff25054d89a7e5c3f15d7.patch

description: This patch focuses on optimizing the base server in Next.js by removing the path polyfill and incremental-cache. These features are primarily needed by the Node.js server and are being removed to make the base server leaner. The changes involve modifications to webpack configuration, constants, and server-related files.
name: github.com_vercel_next.js_0c95a93858f1fd134a94c188673c53c99dd59431.patch

description: The patch aligns React Root configuration between the server and webpack configuration in Next.js. It ensures that both the server and webpack use the same logic for auto-detecting React 18 and enabling `reactRoot`. The patch also updates the fallback `_error` page to use functional document if concurrent rendering is enabled.
name: github.com_vercel_next.js_1aee93581f7154ca4c191388904c33980cd74653.patch

description: The patch adds a cache control header to prefetch empty responses. Without this header, Cloudflare might cache these responses, causing issues. The added header prevents Cloudflare from caching these responses.
name: github.com_vercel_next.js_20d05958ff853e9c9e42139ffec294336881c648.patch

description: The patch addresses an issue where `.svg` image optimization was not working correctly when a `loader` property was provided to the `Image` component. The fix ensures that SVG images are served as-is when `config.dangerouslyAllowSVG` is not enabled, avoiding proxying through the built-in Image Optimization API. This allows custom loaders to handle SVG images properly.
name: github.com_vercel_next.js_2264d35b647461d78d6f64157eec8667a24f76fb.patch

description: This patch introduces a mechanism to flush styles effects for CSS-in-JS solutions in Next.js applications. It re-introduces flush effects to app-render and removes default support of styled-jsx in `app/`. This allows users to choose their own CSS-in-JS solution with customization.
name: github.com_vercel_next.js_4d0783d9befce60d4cdad1c1c08fb79951d7f946.patch

description: The patch adds a Content Security Policy (CSP) header to the Image Optimization API to prevent XSS attacks. The CSP header restricts script execution to 'none' and sandboxes the content. This prevents the execution of malicious scripts embedded within SVG images served by the API.
name: github.com_vercel_next.js_7afc97c5744b38bdf36aa7f87625f438224688aa.patch

description: The patch removes an invalid default fallback for the `revalidate` value in Next.js. The `revalidate` value was defaulting to 1 if not explicitly returned from render, which is incorrect. This ensures that `render` always returns a valid `revalidate` value.
name: github.com_vercel_next.js_7ed7f125e07ef0517a331009ed7e32691ba403d3.patch

description: The patch introduces configuration options `dangerouslyAllowSVG` and `contentSecurityPolicy` to handle SVG images. SVGs can have embedded scripts leading to XSS vulnerabilities if not properly handled. The patch allows developers to serve SVG images while encouraging them to configure a strict Content Security Policy to mitigate XSS risks.
name: github.com_vercel_next.js_8a55612c0d37d5b3fb6726eaa310aad01e0b42ab.patch

description: The application was vulnerable to open redirect by relying on request headers to determine the hostname for internal redirects. The fix ensures that internal redirects use the internal hostname directly, mitigating the risk of malicious redirects. This is achieved by setting and using the `__NEXT_PRIVATE_HOST` environment variable.
name: github.com_vercel_next.js_8f7a6ca7d21a97bc9f7a1bbe10427b5ad74b9085.patch

description: The patch removes an invalid default fallback value for the `revalidate` property in the Next.js server. The code previously defaulted to a minimum revalidate time if no explicit value was returned from `render`. This change ensures that `render` always returns a valid `revalidate` value or sets it to `0` in case of an error.
name: github.com_vercel_next.js_bd164d53af259c05f1ab434004bcfdd3837d7cda.patch

description: This patch introduces runtime configuration detection for functions manifest in Next.js. It removes the runtime option in the functions manifest when the page config specifies 'nodejs' as the runtime. Additionally, it uses 'runtime: web' for pages that enable `concurrentFeatures` and the filesystem API.
name: github.com_vercel_next.js_c8fd6d89eb7599914648a8e31cf0aad1f9822f63.patch

description: The patch focuses on fixing an issue where image configurations were not being applied correctly to images imported from `node_modules`. This ensures that images from external modules are processed according to the specified image configuration in the Next.js application. The changes involve updating image component logic and context to handle configurations properly.
name: github.com_vercel_next.js_e2d6c311b5cc81ac36fa2c4866108d05684328b3.patch

description: This patch focuses on exporting the URLPattern from `next/server` to allow users to import it without causing runtime errors in Node.js functions. The vulnerability lies in the potential for runtime errors due to the exposure of URLPattern as a global object on Edge Runtime only. Importing from `next/server` avoids risking runtime errors and incorrect type definitions.
name: github.com_vercel_next.js_e3181c2d7798d801ac849aab02994932f76a8923.patch

description: The patch addresses an issue where the React development bundle was being incorrectly used in production mode. This occurred because the `NODE_ENV` environment variable was not set when React was initially required. This resulted in incorrect context being passed from the provider to the consumer.
name: github.com_vercel_next.js_e9d23d709cdc0d64ad22277a4eb782c6261dd0fa.patch

description: The patch fixes unhandled promise rejections that occur when a connection is canceled, specifically within the edge runtime of Next.js. This can lead to denial of service by crashing the application. The fix involves properly handling errors during the request body finalization process.
name: github.com_vercel_next.js_f1aac90c7bafd82a680cf7d11ab810fad19d0d24.patch

description: This patch removes an experimental image optimization feature. The feature aimed to automatically add preload tags for images. It was never fully functional or publicly announced, and removing it does not introduce breaking changes or security concerns.
name: github.com_vercel_next.js_f5163046494f4f88510cd48f11e3b64e3128d41d.patch

description: The patch fixes a path traversal vulnerability in the Vite development server's static file serving middleware. The vulnerability arises from insufficient restrictions on accessing files outside the allowed directories.  By modifying the `_matchOptions` and ensuring the `deny` patterns consider subdirectories, the patch prevents unauthorized access to sensitive files and directories like `.deny` and `deny.txt`.
name: github.com_vitejs_vite_011bbca350e447d1b499d242804ce62738c12bc0.patch

description: The patch addresses a vulnerability where sensitive files (like .env) could be accessed due to case-insensitive file system issues. The fix involves modifying the `serveRawFsMiddleware` function to prevent access to these files by adding a `nocase: true` option in the file matching logic. This ensures that file access is case-sensitive, preventing unauthorized access.
name: github.com_vitejs_vite_0cd769c279724cf27934b1270fbdd45d68217691.patch

description: The patch addresses a potential DOM clobbering vulnerability in the `getRelativeUrlFromDocument` function. The original code used `document.currentScript.src` without validating the tag name. This could be exploited by an attacker to inject malicious code via DOM clobbering.
name: github.com_vitejs_vite_179b17773cf35c73ddb041f9e6c703fd9f3126af.patch

description: The patch addresses a path traversal vulnerability in Vite's static file serving. The vulnerability arises from allowing access to arbitrary files on the file system using the /@fs/ prefix. The fix introduces checks to ensure that only allowed files are served, preventing attackers from accessing sensitive information.
name: github.com_vitejs_vite_4573a6fd6f1b097fb7296a3e135e0646b996b249.patch

description: The patch addresses an issue where `fs.deny` with globs containing directories was not working as expected in Vite. The `picomatch` library's `matchBase` option had issues with patterns not containing `/`, leading to incorrect denial behavior. The fix modifies the patterns to ensure they always include a `/` for proper matching.
name: github.com_vitejs_vite_5a056dd2fc80dbafed033062fe6aaf4717309f48.patch

description: The patch fixes a file system access vulnerability in Vite's static file serving middleware. It ensures that requests to /@fs/ paths are properly authorized and restricted to prevent unauthorized access to files outside the designated root directory. The vulnerability could allow an attacker to read arbitrary files on the server.
name: github.com_vitejs_vite_6820bb3b9a54334f3268fc5ee1e967d2e1c0db34.patch

description: The application is vulnerable to path traversal due to improper decoding of URLs. Specifically, the code uses `decodeURI` instead of `decodeURIComponent`, which does not correctly handle encoded characters in the URL. This allows attackers to access files outside the intended directory by crafting URLs with escaped characters, such as `%2e%2e%2f`.
name: github.com_vitejs_vite_6851009e6725b17608113a5a63474280075cae1c.patch

description: The patch allows disabling built-in shortcuts in Vite's CLI. It introduces an option to define `action: undefined` for a shortcut key to disable it. This prevents the execution of unwanted or potentially harmful actions triggered by the CLI shortcuts.
name: github.com_vitejs_vite_7fd7c6cebfcad34ae7021ebee28f97b1f28ef3f3.patch

description: The patch prevents path traversal by sanitizing the URL, specifically handling leading double slashes. Without this fix, an attacker could potentially access files outside the intended directory. The vulnerability is fixed by removing leading slashes from the request URL before processing it.
name: github.com_vitejs_vite_813ddd6155c3d54801e264ba832d8347f6f66b32.patch

description: The patch addresses a path traversal vulnerability in Vite's file serving logic. The `fs.deny` configuration was not correctly handling patterns without slashes, allowing access to unintended files. The fix ensures that patterns are correctly matched, preventing unauthorized file access.
name: github.com_vitejs_vite_89c7c645f09d16a38f146ef4a1528f218e844d67.patch

description: The patch fixes a path traversal vulnerability related to case-insensitive file systems. The vulnerability allows access to files like `.env` with different casing. The fix configures picomatch to be case-insensitive when matching against the `fs.deny` list.
name: github.com_vitejs_vite_91641c4da0a011d4c5352e88fc68389d4e1289a5.patch

description: The patch fixes a path traversal vulnerability in Vite's file system serving logic. The `fs.deny` configuration, which is meant to restrict access to certain files, was not working correctly with globs containing directories. The fix modifies how the glob patterns are handled to ensure proper denial of access to specified paths.
name: github.com_vitejs_vite_96a7f3a41ef2f9351c46f3ab12489bb4efa03cc9.patch

description: The patch addresses a potential DOM clobbering vulnerability. The vulnerability occurs in the `getRelativeUrlFromDocument` function when constructing a URL based on `document.currentScript.src`. By adding a check for `document.currentScript.tagName.toUpperCase() === 'SCRIPT'`, the patch mitigates the risk of unintended URL manipulation.
name: github.com_vitejs_vite_ade1d89660e17eedfd35652165b0c26905259fad.patch

description: The patch addresses a path traversal vulnerability where a malicious user could potentially access files outside the intended directory by using special characters in the URL. The fix involves re-encoding the URL to prevent bypassing the fs.allow restriction. The tests confirm that unsafe fetches with special characters are now correctly blocked.
name: github.com_vitejs_vite_b8356991c0a7dae32fb70b613460f15027915aa7.patch

description: The patch fixes an issue with the `fs.deny` configuration in Vite's development server. Specifically, it addresses the problem where glob patterns with directories were not being correctly processed when denying access to files. The fix involves modifying how the `picomatch` library is used to handle the `fs.deny` patterns.
name: github.com_vitejs_vite_ba5269cca81de3f5fbb0f49d58a1c55688043258.patch

description: The patch fixes a path traversal vulnerability in Vite's file system serving logic. The `fs.deny` configuration option, which is intended to restrict access to certain files, was not correctly handling glob patterns that included directories. This could allow attackers to bypass the intended restrictions and access sensitive files or directories.
name: github.com_vitejs_vite_d2db33f7d4b96750b35370c70dd2c35ec3b9b649.patch

description: The patch modifies the paths for static assets like images in the UI. It fixes issues related to custom skinning and branding configurations in the application, specifically how the header logo and login background images are loaded. The changes ensure that the images are loaded from the correct static directory.
name: github.com_vmware_harbor_51297cdfd7318e96f44d09a21c12487375a919eb.patch

description: The patch addresses a workspace security issue in the reStructuredText extension. It introduces a workspace trust flag to disable potentially unsafe workspace settings like tool paths in untrusted workspaces. This mitigates risks associated with running commands or tools from an untrusted source.
name: github.com_vscode-restructuredtext_vscode-restructuredtext_1dd3e878a5559e3dfe0e48f145c90418b208c5af.patch

description: The patch disables screenshots by default. This may address a privacy concern or performance issue.  The change is made in the shared-data.ts file.
name: github.com_vuejs_devtools_3444bdd89c49092a37715f2706caca3e695591a5.patch

description: The patch addresses a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the VCalendar component related to the eventName function. The eventName function could render arbitrary HTML, leading to potential XSS attacks. The fix converts the eventName function to render VNodes instead of arbitrary HTML, preventing the injection of malicious scripts.
name: github.com_vuetifyjs_vuetify_ade1434927f55a0eccf3d54f900f24c5fa85a176.patch

description: The patch addresses a denial-of-service vulnerability related to unbounded regex backtracking in the time unit parsing logic. The vulnerability occurs due to inefficient regular expressions used to parse time units, potentially leading to excessive computation and DoS. The fix introduces a new function and adjusts the regex to limit backtracking.
name: github.com_wanasit_chrono_98815b57622443b5c498a427210ebd603d705f4c.patch

description: The patch addresses multiple XSS vulnerabilities. The application was vulnerable to XSS via code insertion, image upload, and link creation due to improper input sanitization. The fix involves escaping HTML entities and attributes to prevent the execution of malicious scripts.
name: github.com_wangeditor-team_wangEditor_6257a2e166346913c34ac5cfb31b6a46e9544c5a.patch

description: The patch enhances the backend service to get the plugin configuration. It specifically addresses an issue where the password field within the host's configuration was not properly obfuscated. The fix ensures that sensitive password information is replaced with '*****' for security purposes.
name: github.com_wazuh_wazuh-kibana-app_6290e99887fb20f84e2dba21e4f1255d7ad4e69e.patch

description: The patch updates the web3-utils package. It fixes an issue in the `mergeDeep` function within `objects.ts` by ensuring a proper clone of the destination object before merging. This prevents unintended modifications to the original destination object.
name: github.com_web3_web3.js_8ed041c6635d807b3da8960ad49e125e3d1b0e80.patch

description: The patch updates the react-rich-text-renderer component to sanitize HTML before rendering it, mitigating a potential XSS vulnerability. It uses the `sanitize-html` library to sanitize the HTML content and allowlist specific tags and attributes. The patch introduces a `configureSanitization` function and `sanitizationConfig` prop to allow developers to configure sanitization preferences globally or for specific components.
name: github.com_webiny_webiny-js_8748bc53fe862bb03d4459ccc0be39084a5d35c0.patch

description: The patch addresses a performance issue related to full-text search. The `useSWRxFullTextSearch` hook was making unnecessary requests when the keyword was null. This change avoids making search requests when the keyword is empty, preventing excessive server load.
name: github.com_weseek_growi_b584e2a47ee3c8ce1d8ef38238302825c015327e.patch

description: The patch mitigates a potential open redirect vulnerability in the Electron-based Wire application. The vulnerability arises from opening external URLs without proper validation, which could lead to users being redirected to malicious websites. The fix involves validating URLs and preventing the opening of insecure or non-website URLs.
name: github.com_wireapp_wire-desktop_b3705fffa75a03f055530f55a754face5ac0623b.patch

description: The patch removes support for ".jpg-large" image types. The application now validates image types against a list of allowed MIME types, preventing unsupported or potentially malicious image formats from being processed. This fix mitigates potential risks associated with processing untrusted image data.
name: github.com_wireapp_wire-webapp_056e39d327bb10c1b0958dfbea0c39752692a1b0.patch

description: The patch focuses on improving the user experience of the AppLock modal by ensuring that input elements are properly focused. This is achieved by adding `onBlur` and `ref` attributes to the input elements. This ensures that the input field receives focus even if it loses focus.
name: github.com_wireapp_wire-webapp_281f2a9d795f68abe423c116d5da4e1e73a60062.patch

description: The patch fixes an issue in filtering events loaded from a conversation. It ensures that expired ephemeral events are filtered out when searching within a conversation. The change removes a parameter related to loading expired messages and implements filtering based on `ephemeral_expires` property.
name: github.com_wireapp_wire-webapp_42c9a1edddbdd5d4d8f9a196a98f6fc19bb21741.patch

description: The patch addresses a potential cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the message rendering component. The `renderMessage` function was not properly escaping user-provided content, allowing attackers to inject malicious scripts into the rendered output. The fix involves escaping the code block and mention texts before rendering them.
name: github.com_wireapp_wire-webapp_d14455252a949dc83f36d45e2babbdd9328af2a4.patch

description: This patch updates the Wireshark project with new manufacturer, service, and enterprise numbers. It also includes translation updates. There is no vulnerability associated with this patch.
name: github.com_wireshark_wireshark_5b385f3a4dd1a82cae6d62e5563d1d7d9a0a80cf.patch

description: The patch updates the manuf, services enterprise numbers, translations, and other items. This change includes updates to the list of USB vendors and products. The translations for various languages are also updated.
name: github.com_wireshark_wireshark_e8e8b0d0b46941f79535c020f5464c372d0138a7.patch

description: The patch forces `isEvalSupported` to `false`. This likely mitigates a vulnerability related to the usage of `eval` in the pdf.js library, which is used by react-pdf. Disabling `eval` can prevent code injection or other security issues.
name: github.com_wojtekmaj_react-pdf_208f28dd47fe38c33ce4bac4205b2b0a0bb207fe.patch

description: The patch forces the `isEvalSupported` option to false. This likely mitigates a vulnerability related to the use of `eval` or similar functions in the pdf.js library, which could lead to arbitrary code execution. The change addresses GHSA-wgrm-67xf-hhpq.
name: github.com_wojtekmaj_react-pdf_671e6eaa2e373e404040c13cc6b668fe39839cad.patch

description: The patch ensures that the `x-workos-session` header is always controlled by the application. This prevents potential issues arising from uncontrolled or unexpected session header values. The application explicitly deletes the header before proceeding with session handling.
name: github.com_workos_authkit-nextjs_6c3f4f3179d66cbb15de3962792083ff3b244a01.patch

description: The patch removes the 'Request Terminfo String' handler. The handler was not supported. Removing unused code can improve security by reducing the attack surface.
name: github.com_xtermjs_xterm.js_3592c641cd0348e0b698e8a180aea2072c6bcd9a.patch

description: The patch fixes a potential command injection vulnerability in the `clone` function. The vulnerability occurs because the `repository` and `dest` parameters were not properly sanitized before being passed to the `gitExec` function. The fix constructs the command differently to avoid injection by adding '--' before the parameters.
name: github.com_yarkeev_git-interface_f828aa790016fee3aa667f7b44cf94bf0aa8c60d.patch

description: The patch addresses a potential denial-of-service vulnerability related to catastrophic backtracking in the blockquote escape replacer. The regular expressions used to process blockquotes were inefficient, potentially leading to excessive processing time and resource consumption. The updated regular expressions prevent this by improving the matching logic.
name: github.com_yhatt_jsx-slack_46bc88391d89d5fda4ce689e18ca080bcdd29ecc.patch

description: The code uses `execSync` and `execFileSync` to execute shell commands based on user-controlled input (`applicationId`). This can lead to command injection if the input is not properly sanitized. The patch replaces `execSync` with `execFileSync` and passes the arguments as an array to avoid shell interpretation.
name: github.com_zamotany_logkitty_ef2f673e25c629544dd3de6429999318447dd6bf.patch

description: This patch updates the help text for the `next build`, `next dev`, `next export`, and `next start` commands. The `<dir>` reference in the help text is updated to clarify that it represents the directory of the Next.js application, not the output directory.
name: github.com_zeit_next.js_527453560e1dde8c670266c3b42bcf3a58dee155.patch

description: The patch fixes an issue in the MembersTableComponent where deleting a role from a member's role list using `splice` was not done correctly. The original code omitted the second argument in the `splice` call, causing unexpected behavior.  This fix ensures the correct role is removed from the array.
name: github.com_zitadel_zitadel_2ece8ffaa77673ff8fae21bce65eff98048bf0cb.patch

description: This patch updates the application to use static data-e2e attributes. It ensures consistent naming for the attributes.  The changes are primarily focused on improving testability and maintainability of the codebase.
name: github.com_zitadel_zitadel_44fc2efbb7af315c1708f7660b232481d44fdc1c.patch

description: The patch fixes an issue where the default base profile was missing in the configuration generated by `zowe config auto-init`. It corrects the order of operations to ensure the default profile is properly set. The missing base profile could lead to unexpected behavior or configuration errors.
name: github.com_zowe_zowe-cli_6778da5e03c65dfcd3e6e4b4097b94d9fbd5d01b.patch

description: The patch addresses a certificate validation issue in an Electron application. Previously, the application ignored certificate errors without checking the `ignoreCerts` setting, potentially exposing users to man-in-the-middle attacks. The fix ensures that certificate errors are only ignored if explicitly configured by the user, prompting a dialog if an invalid certificate is encountered.
name: github.com_zulip_zulip-desktop_983254c310ea1b7454727b11c45028bf95a98dcb.patch

description: The patch whitelists safe URL protocols for shell.openExternal to prevent attackers from opening arbitrary local files. It restricts the protocols that can be opened directly, redirecting other protocols through an HTML file. This mitigates potential security risks associated with opening untrusted URLs.
name: github.com_zulip_zulip-desktop_a03f569af9c260a931cd71e5c3e489dfbc7a13e2.patch

description: The patch addresses a vulnerability (CVE-2020-10858) related to session permission requests. It locks down these requests by introducing a permission request handler that validates the origin and permission requested before granting access. This prevents potentially malicious origins from gaining unauthorized permissions.
name: github.com_zulip_zulip-desktop_a6d942fe6ce96412173bb4d5c3c42324ffdd2407.patch

description: The patch addresses XSS vulnerabilities by escaping strings interpolated into HTML. It consistently escapes HTML to prevent malicious code execution. The changes improve overall application security and maintainability.
name: github.com_zulip_zulip-desktop_a9d59b3dcdb59c76a3b5dcb99bb61c78634e3a8f.patch

description: The application's regex validation for linkifiers is vulnerable to denial-of-service due to backtracking. User-supplied linkifier patterns can cause denial-of-service when executed. The patch switches to the `re2` library, which guarantees constant-time matching, and removes existing incompatible linkifiers.
name: github.com_zulip_zulip_e2d303c1bb5f538d17dc3d9134bc8858bdece781.patch

description: The code modifies how user inputs are handled to prevent a memory leak. It introduces a `buildSanitizedRankedDictionary` function, ensuring inputs are properly sanitized. This change aims to improve the application's efficiency by avoiding resource exhaustion when processing user-provided data.
name: github.com_zxcvbn-ts_zxcvbn_3f9bed21b5d01f6f6863476822ca857355fba22f.patch
